<BODY>
<DIV id="page_1">
<DIV id="dimg1">
<INGENBILD zsrc="GZB64521x1.jpg/" id="img1">
</DIV>


<P class="p0 ft0">EUROPEAN COMMISSION</P>
<P class="p1 ft1">Brussels, 20.7.2011</P>
<P class="p2 ft1">COM(2011) 452 final</P>
<P class="p3 ft1">2011/0202 (COD)</P>
<P class="p4 ft2">PROPOSAL FOR A</P>
<P class="p5 ft2">REGULATION OF THE EUROPEAN PARLIAMENT AND OF THE COUNCIL</P>
<P class="p6 ft3">on prudential requirements for credit institutions and investment firms PART III</P>
<P class="p7 ft2">(Text with EEA relevance)</P>
<P class="p8 ft4">{SEC(2011) 949 final} {SEC(2011) 950 final}</P>
<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t0">
<TR>
<TD class="tr0 td0"><P class="p9 ft5">EN</P></TD>
<TD class="tr0 td1"><P class="p9 ft5">EN</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_2">


<P class="p10 ft6">Title III</P>
<P class="p11 ft6">Own funds requirements for operational risk</P>
<P class="p12 ft7">Chapter 1</P>
<P class="p13 ft7">General principles governing the use of the different approaches</P>
<P class="p14 ft8">Article 301</P>
<P class="p15 ft8">Permission and notification</P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">To qualify for use of the Standardised Approach, institutions shall meet the criteria set out in Article 309, in addition to meeting the general risk management standards set out in Articles 73 and 83of Directive [inserted by OP]. Institutions shall notify the competent authorities prior to using the Standardised Approach.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p17 ft1">Competent authorities shall permit institutions to use an alternative relevant indicator for the business lines "retail banking" and "commercial banking" where the conditions set out in Articles 308(2) and 309 are met.</P>
<P class="p18 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Competent authorities shall permit institutions to use Advanced Measurement Approaches based on their own operational risk measurement systems, where all the qualitative and quantitative standards set out in Articles 310 and 311 respectively are met and where institutions meet the general risk management standards set out in Articles 73 and 83of Directive [inserted by OP] and Section II, Chapter 3, Title VII of that Directive.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p19 ft1">Institutions shall also apply for permission from their competent authorities where they want to implement material extensions and changes to those Advanced Measurement Approaches. Competent authorities shall grant the permission only where institutions would continue to meet the standards specified in the first subparagraph following those material extensions and changes.</P>
<P class="p20 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">EBA shall develop draft regulatory technical standards to specify the following:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p21 ft4"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft10">the assessment methodology under which the competent authorities permit institutions to use Advanced Measurement Approaches;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">the conditions for assessing the materiality of extensions and changes to the Advanced Measurement Approaches.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p23 ft1">EBA shall submit those draft regulatory technical standards to the Commission by 31 December 2013.</P>
<P class="p24 ft1">Power is delegated to the Commission to adopt the regulatory technical standards referred to in the first subparagraph in accordance with the procedure laid down in Articles 10 to 14 of Regulation (EU) No 1093/2010.</P>
<P class="p25 ft1">1</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_3">


<P class="p26 ft8">Article 302</P>
<P class="p27 ft8">Reverting to the use of less sophisticated approaches</P>
<P class="p28 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Institutions that use the Standardised Approach shall not revert to the use of the Basic Indicator Approach unless the conditions in paragraph 3 are met.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p29 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Institutions that use the Advanced Measurement Approaches shall not revert to the use of the Standardised Approach or the Basic Indicator Approach unless the conditions in paragraph 3 are met.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p18 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">An institution may only revert to the use of a less sophisticated approach for operational risk where both the following conditions are met:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">the institution has demonstrated to the satisfaction of the competent authority that the use of a less sophisticated approach is not proposed in order to reduce the operational risk related own funds requirements of the institution, is necessary on the basis of nature and complexity of the institution and would not have a material adverse impact on the solvency of the institution or its ability to manage operational risk effectively;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p30 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">the institution has received the prior permission of the competent authority.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p31 ft8">Article 303</P>
<P class="p32 ft8">Combined used of different approaches</P>
<P class="p33 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Institutions may use a combination of approaches provided that they obtain permission from the competent authorities. Competent authorities shall grant such permission where the requirements set out in paragraphs 2 to 4, as applicable, are met.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p18 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">An institution may use an Advanced Measurement Approach in combination with either the Basic Indicator Approach or the Standardised Approach, where both the following conditions are met:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p34 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">the combination of Approaches used by the institution captures all its operational risks and competent authorities are satisfied with the methodology used by the institution to cover different activities, geographical locations, legal structures or other relevant divisions determined on an internal basis;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p35 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">the criteria set out in Article 309 and the standards set out in Articles 310 and 311 are fulfilled for the part of activities covered by the Standardised Approach and the Advanced Measurement Approaches respectively.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p18 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">For institutions that want to use an Advanced Measurement Approach in combination with either the Basic Indicator Approach or the Standardised Approach competent authorities may, on a </SPAN><NOBR>case-by</NOBR> case basis, impose the following additional conditions for granting permission:</P>
<P class="p35 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">on the date of implementation of an Advanced Measurement Approach, a significant part of the institution's operational risks are captured by that Approach;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p36 ft1">2</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_4">


<P class="p37 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">the institution takes a commitment to apply the Advanced Measurement Approach across a material part of its operations within a time schedule that was submitted to and approved by its competent authorities.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p18 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">An institution may request permission from a competent authority to use a combination of the Basic Indicator Approach and the Standardised Approach only in exceptional circumstances such as the recent acquisition of new business which may require a transition period for the application of the Standardised Approach.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p17 ft1">A competent authority shall grant such permission only where the institution has committed to apply the Standardised Approach within a time schedule that was submitted to and approved by the competent authority.</P>
<P class="p38 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">EBA shall develop draft regulatory technical standards to specify the following:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p39 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">the conditions that competent authorities shall use when assessing the methodology referred to in point (a) of paragraph 2;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p40 ft4"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft13">the conditions that the competent authorities shall use when deciding whether to impose the additional conditions referred to in paragraph 3.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p41 ft1">EBA shall submit those draft regulatory technical standards to the Commission by 31 December 2016.</P>
<P class="p24 ft1">Power is delegated to the Commission to adopt the regulatory technical standards referred to in the first subparagraph in accordance with the procedure laid down in Articles 10 to 14 of Regulation (EU) No 1093/2010.</P>
<P class="p42 ft7">Chapter 2</P>
<P class="p43 ft7">Basic indicator approach</P>
<P class="p44 ft8">Article 304</P>
<P class="p45 ft8">Capital requirement</P>
<P class="p46 ft1">Under the Basic Indicator Approach, the own funds requirement for operational risk is equal to 15 % of the average over three years of the relevant indicator as defined in Article 305.</P>
<P class="p47 ft1">Institutions shall calculate the average over three years of the relevant indicator on the basis of the last three <NOBR>twelve-monthly</NOBR> observations at the end of the financial year. When audited figures are not available, institutions may use business estimates.</P>
<P class="p48 ft1">Where for any given observation, the relevant indicator is negative or equal to zero, institutions shall not take into account this figure in the calculation of the average over three years. Institutions shall calculate the average over three years as the sum of positive figures divided by the number of positive figures.</P>
<P class="p49 ft1">3</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_5">
<DIV id="dimg1">
<INGENBILD zsrc="GZB64525x1.jpg/" id="img1">
</DIV>


<P class="p26 ft8">Article 305</P>
<P class="p50 ft8">Relevant indicator</P>
<P class="p33 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">For institutions applying accounting standards established by Directive 86/635/EEC, based on the accounting categories for the profit and loss account of institutions under Article 27 of that Directive, the relevant indicator is the sum of the elements listed in Table 1of this paragraph. Institutions shall include each element in the sum with its positive or negative sign.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p51 ft1">Table 1</P>
<P class="p52 ft1">1 Interest receivable and similar income</P>
<P class="p52 ft1">2 Interest payable and similar charges</P>
<P class="p53 ft1">3 Income from shares and other <NOBR>variable/fixed-yield</NOBR> securities</P>
<P class="p52 ft1">4 Commissions/fees receivable</P>
<P class="p52 ft1">5 Commissions/fees payable</P>
<P class="p54 ft4">6 Net profit or net loss on financial operations</P>
<P class="p55 ft1">7 Other operating income</P>
<P class="p56 ft1">Institutions shall adjust these elements to reflect the following qualifications:</P>
<P class="p39 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">institutions shall calculate the relevant indicator before the deduction of any provisions and operating expenses. Institutions shall include in operating expenses fees paid for outsourcing services rendered by third parties which are not a parent or subsidiary of the institution or a subsidiary of a parent which is also the parent of the institution. Institutions may use expenditure on the outsourcing of services rendered by third parties to reduce the relevant indicator where the expenditure is incurred from an undertaking subject to rules under, or equivalent to, this Regulation;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p57 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">institutions shall not use the following elements in the calculation of the relevant indicator:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p58 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft14">realised profits/losses from the sale of </SPAN><NOBR>non-trading</NOBR> book items;</P>
<P class="p59 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft15">income from extraordinary or irregular items;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p60 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft16">income derived from insurance.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p39 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">when revaluation of trading items is part of the profit and loss statement, institutions may include revaluation. When institutions apply Article 36(2) of Directive 86/635/EEC, they shall include revaluation booked in the profit and loss account.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p61 ft1">4</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_6">
<DIV id="dimg1">
<INGENBILD zsrc="GZB64526x1.jpg/" id="img1">
</DIV>


<P class="p62 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">When institutions apply accounting standards different from the ones established by Directive 86/635/EEC, they shall calculate the relevant indicator on the basis of data that best reflect the definition set out in this Article.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p63 ft4"><SPAN class="ft1">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft17">EBA shall develop draft regulatory technical standards to determine the methodology to calculate the relevant indicator referred to in paragraph 2.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p64 ft1">EBA shall submit those draft regulatory technical standards to the Commission by 31 December 2016.</P>
<P class="p65 ft1">Power is delegated to the Commission to adopt the regulatory technical standards referred to in the first subparagraph in accordance with the procedure laid down in Articles 10 to 14 of Regulation (EU) No 1093/2010.</P>
<P class="p66 ft7">Chapter 3</P>
<P class="p67 ft7">Standardised approach</P>
<P class="p68 ft8">Article 306</P>
<P class="p69 ft8">Own funds requirement</P>
<P class="p70 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Under the Standardised Approach, institutions shall divide their activities into the business lines set out in Table 2 of paragraph 4 and in accordance with the principles set out in Article 307.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p71 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Institutions shall calculate the own funds requirement for operational risk as the average over three years of the sum of the annual own funds requirements across all business lines referred to in Table 2 of paragraph 4. The annual own funds requirement of each business line is equal to the product of the corresponding beta factor referred to in that Table and the part of the relevant indicator mapped to the current business line.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p72 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">In any given year, institutions may offset negative own funds requirements resulting from a negative part of the relevant indicator in any business line with positive own funds requirements in other business lines without limit. However, where the aggregate own funds requirement across all business lines within a given year is negative, institutions shall use the value zero as the input to the numerator for that year.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p72 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Institutions shall calculate the average over three years of the sum referred to in paragraph 2 on the basis of the last three </SPAN><NOBR>twelve-monthly</NOBR> observations at the end of the financial year. When audited figures are not available, institutions may use business estimates.</P>
<P class="p73 ft1">Table 2</P>
<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t1">
<TR>
<TD class="tr1 td2"><P class="p74 ft1">Business line</P></TD>
<TD class="tr1 td3"><P class="p75 ft1">List of activities</P></TD>
<TD class="tr1 td4"><P class="p75 ft1">Percentage</P></TD>
<TD class="tr1 td5"><P class="p9 ft1">(beta</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="tr2 td6"><P class="p9 ft18"> </P></TD>
<TD class="tr2 td7"><P class="p9 ft18"> </P></TD>
<TD class="tr2 td8"><P class="p75 ft1">factor)</P></TD>
<TD class="tr2 td9"><P class="p9 ft18"> </P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>

<P class="p84 ft8">Article 307</P>
<P class="p85 ft8">Principles for business line mapping</P>
<P class="p86 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Institutions shall develop and document specific policies and criteria for mapping the relevant indicator for current business lines and activities into the standardised framework set out in article 306. They shall review and adjust those policies and criteria as appropriate for new or changing business activities and risks.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p87 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Institutions shall apply the following principles for business line mapping:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p88 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">institutions shall map all activities into the business lines in a mutually exclusive and jointly exhaustive manner;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p88 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">institutions shall allocate any activity which cannot be readily mapped into the business line framework, but which represents an ancillary activity to an activity included in the framework, to the business line it supports. Where more than one business line is supported through the ancillary activity, institutions shall use an </SPAN><NOBR>objective-mapping</NOBR> criterion;</P>
<P class="p89 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">where an activity cannot be mapped into a particular business line then institutions shall use the business line yielding the highest percentage. The same business line equally applies to any ancillary activity associated with that activity;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p90 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">institutions may use internal pricing methods to allocate the relevant indicator between business lines. Costs generated in one business line which are imputable to a different business line may be reallocated to the business line to which they pertain;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p91 ft4"><SPAN class="ft1">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft10">the mapping of activities into business lines for operational risk capital purposes shall be consistent with the categories institutions use for credit and market risks;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p92 ft1">7</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_9">


<P class="p93 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft30">senior management shall be responsible for the mapping policy under the control of the management body of the institution;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(g)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">institutions shall subject the mapping process to business lines to independent review.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p16 ft4"><SPAN class="ft1">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft17">EBA shall develop draft implementing technical standards to determine the conditions of application of the principles for business line mapping provided in this Article.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p41 ft1">EBA shall submit those draft implementing technical standards to the Commission by 31 December 2017.</P>
<P class="p24 ft1">Power is conferred on the Commission to adopt the implementing technical standards referred to in the first subparagraph in accordance with the procedure laid down in Article 15 of Regulation (EU) No 1093/2010.</P>
<P class="p95 ft8">Article 308</P>
<P class="p96 ft8">Alternative Standardised Approach</P>
<P class="p33 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Under the Alternative Standardised Approach, for the business lines "retail banking" and "commercial banking", institutions shall apply the following:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">the relevant indicator is a normalised income indicator equal to the nominal amount of loans and advances multiplied by 0.035;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">the loans and advances consist of the total drawn amounts in the corresponding credit portfolios. For the "commercial banking" business line, institutions shall also include securities held in the non trading book in the nominal amount of loans and advances.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p18 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">To be permitted to use the Alternative Standardised Approach, the institution shall meet all the following conditions:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">its retail or commercial banking activities shall account for at least 90 % of its income;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p97 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">a significant proportion of its retail or commercial banking activities shall comprise loans associated with a high probability of default;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">the alternative standardised approach provides an appropriate basis for calculating its own funds requirement for operational risk.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p18 ft4"><SPAN class="ft1">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft17">EBA shall develop regulatory technical standards to further specify the conditions for the use of the Alternative Standardised Approach referred to in paragraph 2.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p41 ft1">EBA shall submit those draft regulatory technical standards to the Commission by 31 December 2016.</P>
<P class="p24 ft1">Power is delegated to the Commission to adopt the regulatory technical standards referred to in the first subparagraph in accordance with the procedure laid down in Articles 10 to 14 of Regulation (EU) No 1093/2010.</P>
<P class="p98 ft1">8</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_10">


<P class="p26 ft8">Article 309</P>
<P class="p99 ft8">Criteria for the standardised approach</P>
<P class="p100 ft1">The criteria referred to in subparagraph 1 of Article 301(1) are the following:</P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">institutions shall have in place a </SPAN><NOBR>well-documented</NOBR> assessment and management system for operational risk with clear responsibilities assigned for this system. They shall identify their exposures to operational risk and track relevant operational risk data, including material loss data. This system shall be subject to regular independent review;</P>
<P class="p18 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">an institutions operational risk assessment system shall be closely integrated into the risk management processes of the institution. Its output shall be an integral part of the process of monitoring and controlling the institution's operational risk profile;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p18 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">institutions shall implement a system of reporting to senior management that provides operational risk reports to relevant functions within the institutions. Institutions shall have in place procedures for taking appropriate action according to the information within the reports to management.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p101 ft7">Chapter 4</P>
<P class="p102 ft7">Advanced measurement approaches</P>
<P class="p103 ft33"><SPAN class="ft32">S</SPAN>ECTION <SPAN class="ft32">1</SPAN></P>
<P class="p104 ft33"><SPAN class="ft32">Q</SPAN>UALIFYING CRITERIA</P>
<P class="p105 ft8">Article 310</P>
<P class="p106 ft8">Qualitative standards</P>
<P class="p100 ft1">The qualitative standards referred to in Article 301(2) are the following:</P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">an institution's internal operational risk measurement system shall be closely integrated into its </SPAN><NOBR>day-to-day</NOBR> risk management processes;</P>
<P class="p107 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">institutions shall have an independent risk management function for operational risk;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">institutions shall have in place regular reporting of operational risk exposures and loss experience and shall have in place procedures for taking appropriate corrective action;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">an institution's risk management system shall be well documented. Institution shall have in place routines for ensuring compliance and policies for the treatment of </SPAN><NOBR>non-compliance;</NOBR></P>
<P class="p29 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">institution shall subject their operational risk management processes and measurement systems to regular reviews performed by internal or external auditors;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p38 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft34">an institution's internal validation processes shall operate in a sound and effective manner;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p33 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(g)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">data flows and processes associated with an institution's the risk measurement system shall be transparent and accessible.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p108 ft1">9</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_11">


<P class="p26 ft8">Article 311</P>
<P class="p69 ft8">Quantitative Standards</P>
<P class="p33 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The quantitative standards referred to in Article 301(2) include the standards relating to process, to internal data, to external data, to scenario analysis, to business environment and to internal control factors referred to in paragraphs 2 to 6 respectively.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p38 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The standards relating to process are the following:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p39 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">institutions shall calculate their own funds requirement as comprising both expected loss and unexpected loss, unless expected loss is adequately captured in their internal business practices. The operational risk measure shall capture potentially severe tail events, achieving a soundness standard comparable to a 99.9 % confidence interval over a one year period;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p109 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">an institutions operational risk measurement system shall include the use of internal data, external data, scenario analysis and factors reflecting the business environment and internal control systems as set out in paragraphs 3 to 6. An institution shall have in place a well documented approach for weighting the use of these four elements in its overall operational risk measurement system;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">an institution's risk measurement system shall capture the major drivers of risk affecting the shape of the tail of the estimated distribution of losses;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p35 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">institutions may recognise correlations in operational risk losses across individual operational risk estimates only where their systems for measuring correlations are sound, implemented with integrity, and take into account the uncertainty surrounding any such correlation estimates, particularly in periods of stress. Institutions shall validate their correlation assumptions using appropriate quantitative and qualitative techniques;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">an institution's risk measurement system shall be internally consistent and shall avoid the multiple counting of qualitative assessments or risk mitigation techniques recognised in other areas of this Regulation.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p38 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The standards relating to internal data are the following:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p39 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">institutions shall base their internally generated operational risk measures on a minimum historical observation period of five years. When an institution first moves to an Advanced Measurement Approach, it may use a </SPAN><NOBR>three-year</NOBR> historical observation period;</P>
<P class="p35 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">institutions shall be able to map their historical internal loss data into the business lines defined in Article 306 and into the event types defined in Article 313, and to provide these data to competent authorities upon request. In exceptional circumstances, an institution may allocate loss events which affect the entire institution to an additional business line "corporate items". Institutions shall have in place documented, objective criteria for allocating losses to the specified business lines and event types. Institutions shall record the operational risk losses that are related to credit risk and that institutions have historically included in the internal credit risk databases in the operational risk databases and shall identify them separately. Such losses shall not be subject to the operational risk charge, as long as institutions continue to treat them as credit risk for the purposes of calculating own funds requirements. Institutions shall include operational</SPAN></P>
<P class="p110 ft1">10</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_12">


<P class="p111 ft1">risk losses that are related to market risks in the scope of the own funds requirement for operational risk:</P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">an institution's internal loss data shall be comprehensive in that it captures all material activities and exposures from all appropriate </SPAN><NOBR>sub-systems</NOBR> and geographic locations. Institutions shall be able to justify that any excluded activities or exposures, both individually and in combination, would not have a material impact on the overall risk estimates. Institutions shall define appropriate minimum loss thresholds for internal loss data collection;</P>
<P class="p112 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">aside from information on gross loss amounts, institutions shall collect information about the date of the loss event, any recoveries of gross loss amounts, as well as descriptive information about the drivers or causes of the loss event;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">institutions shall have in place specific criteria for assigning loss data arising from a loss event in a centralised function or an activity that spans more than one business line, as well as from related loss events over time;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p35 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft30">institutions shall have in place documented procedures for assessing the </SPAN><NOBR>on-going</NOBR> relevance of historical loss data, including those situations in which judgement overrides, scaling, or other adjustments may be used, to what extent they may be used and who is authorised to make such decisions.</P>
<P class="p113 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The qualifying standards relating to external data are the following:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p39 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">an institution's operational risk measurement system shall use relevant external data, especially when there is reason to believe that the institution is exposed to infrequent, yet potentially severe, losses. An institution shall have a systematic process for determining the situations for which external data shall be used and the methodologies used to incorporate the data in its measurement system;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">institutions shall regularly review the conditions and practices for external data and shall document them and subject them to periodic independent review.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p18 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">An institution shall use scenario analysis of expert opinion in conjunction with external data to evaluate its exposure to high severity events. Over time, the institution shall validate and reassess such assessments through comparison to actual loss experience to ensure their reasonableness.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p114 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">6.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The qualifying standards relating to business environment and internal control factors are the following:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p115 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">an institution's </SPAN><NOBR>firm-wide</NOBR> risk assessment methodology shall capture key business environment and internal control factors that can change the institutions operational risk profile;</P>
<P class="p34 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">institutions shall justify the choice of each factor as a meaningful driver of risk, based on experience and involving the expert judgment of the affected business areas;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">institutions shall be able to justify to competent authorities the sensitivity of risk estimates to changes in the factors and the relative weighting of the various factors. In</SPAN></P>
<P class="p116 ft1">11</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_13">


<P class="p117 ft1">addition to capturing changes in risk due to improvements in risk controls, an institution's risk measurement framework shall also capture potential increases in risk due to greater complexity of activities or increased business volume;</P>
<P class="p35 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">an institution shall document its risk measurement framework and shall subject it to independent review within the institution and by competent authorities. Over time, institutions shall validate and reassess the process and the outcomes through comparison to actual internal loss experience and relevant external data.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p38 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">7.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">EBA shall develop regulatory technical standards to specify the following:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p21 ft4"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft10">the conditions for assessing whether a system is sound and implemented with integrity for the purposes of point (d) of paragraph 2;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">the exceptional circumstances in which an institution may allocate loss events to an additional business line referred to in point (b) of paragraph 3.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p23 ft1">EBA shall submit those draft regulatory technical standards to the Commission by 31 December 2016.</P>
<P class="p24 ft1">Power is delegated to the Commission to adopt the regulatory technical standards referred to in the first subparagraph in accordance with the procedure laid down in Articles 10 to 14 of Regulation (EU) No 1093/2010.</P>
<P class="p95 ft8">Article 312</P>
<P class="p118 ft8">Impact of insurance and other risk transfer mechanisms</P>
<P class="p33 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The competent authorities shall permit institutions to recognise the impact of insurance subject to the conditions set out in paragraphs 2 to 5 and other risk transfer mechanisms where the institution can demonstrate that a noticeable risk mitigating effect is achieved.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p18 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The insurance provider shall be authorised to provide insurance or </SPAN><NOBR>re-insurance</NOBR> and shall have a minimum claims paying ability rating by an eligible ECAI which has been determined by EBA to be associated with credit quality step 3 or above under the rules for the risk weighting of exposures to institutions under Chapter 2.</P>
<P class="p119 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The insurance and the institutions' insurance framework shall meet all the following conditions:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p115 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">the insurance policy has an initial term of no less than one year. For policies with a residual term of less than one year, an institution shall make appropriate haircuts reflecting the declining residual term of the policy, up to a full 100 % haircut for policies with a residual term of 90 days or less;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p35 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">the insurance policy has a minimum notice period for cancellation of the contract of 90 days;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p115 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">the insurance policy has no exclusions or limitations triggered by supervisory actions or, in the case of a failed institution, that preclude the institution receiver or liquidator from recovering the damages suffered or expenses incurred by the institution, except in</SPAN></P>
<P class="p120 ft1">12</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_14">
<DIV id="dimg1">
<INGENBILD zsrc="GZB645214x1.jpg/" id="img1">
</DIV>


<P class="p121 ft1">respect of events occurring after the initiation of receivership or liquidation proceedings in respect of the institution. However, the insurance policy may exclude any fine, penalty, or punitive damages resulting from actions by the competent authorities;</P>
<P class="p90 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">the risk mitigation calculations shall reflect the insurance coverage in a manner that is transparent in its relationship to, and consistent with, the actual likelihood and impact of loss used in the overall determination of operational risk capital;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p88 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">the insurance is provided by a third party entity. In the case of insurance through captives and affiliates, the exposure has to be laid off to an independent third party entity that meets the eligibility criteria set out in paragraph 2;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p122 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft30">the framework for recognising insurance is well reasoned and documented.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p86 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The methodology for recognising insurance shall capture all the following elements through discounts or haircuts in the amount of insurance recognition:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p123 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">where the residual term of the insurance policy is less than one year:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p124 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft14">the residual term of the insurance policy;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p125 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft15">the policy's cancellation terms;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p123 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">the uncertainty of payment as well as mismatches in coverage of insurance policies.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p70 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The reduction in own funds requirements from the recognition of insurances and other risk transfer mechanisms shall not exceed 20 % of the own funds requirement for operational risk before the recognition of risk mitigation techniques.</SPAN></P>

</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="tr4 td60"><P class="p74 ft1">Internal fraud</P></TD>
<TD class="tr4 td57"><P class="p128 ft1">Losses due to acts of a type intended to defraud, misappropriate property or</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="tr5 td60"><P class="p9 ft18"> </P></TD>
<TD class="tr5 td57"><P class="p128 ft1">circumvent regulations, the law or company policy, excluding</P></TD>
</TR>

<DIV id="page_16">


<P class="p132 ft6">Title IV</P>
<P class="p133 ft6">Own funds requirements for market risk</P>
<P class="p12 ft7">Chapter 1</P>
<P class="p134 ft7">General Provisions</P>
<P class="p14 ft8">Article 314</P>
<P class="p135 ft8">Allowances for consolidated requirements</P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Subject to paragraph 2 and only for the purpose of calculating net positions and own funds requirements in accordance with this Title on a consolidated basis, institutions may use positions in one institution or undertaking to offset positions in another institution or undertaking.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p114 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Institutions may apply paragraph 1 only subject to the permission of the competent authorities, which shall be granted if all of the following conditions are met:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">there is a satisfactory allocation of own funds within the group;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">the regulatory, legal or contractual framework in which the institutions operate is such as to guarantee mutual financial support within the group.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Where there are undertakings located in third countries all of the following conditions shall be met in addition to those in paragraph 2:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p97 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">such undertakings have been authorised in a third country and either satisfy the definition of a credit institution or are recognised </SPAN><NOBR>third-country</NOBR> investment firms;</P>
<P class="p35 ft4"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft13">such undertakings comply, on an individual basis, with own funds requirements equivalent to those laid down in this Regulation;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">no regulations exist in the third countries in question which might significantly affect the transfer of funds within the group.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p136 ft1">15</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_17">


<P class="p137 ft7">Chapter 2</P>
<P class="p138 ft7">Own funds requirements for position risk</P>
<P class="p139 ft33"><SPAN class="ft32">S</SPAN>ECTION <SPAN class="ft32">1</SPAN></P>
<P class="p140 ft33"><SPAN class="ft32">G</SPAN>ENERAL PROVISIONS AND SPECIFIC INSTRUMENTS</P>
<P class="p141 ft8">Article 315</P>
<P class="p142 ft8">Own funds requirements for position risk</P>
<P class="p46 ft1">The institution's own funds requirement for position risk shall be the sum of the own funds requirements for the general and specific risk of its positions in debt and equity instruments. Securitisation positions in the trading book shall be treated as debt instruments.</P>
<P class="p95 ft8">Article 316</P>
<P class="p143 ft8">Netting</P>
<P class="p33 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The absolute value of the excess of an institution's long (short) positions over its short (long) positions in the same equity, debt and convertible issues and identical financial futures, options, warrants and covered warrants shall be its net position in each of those different instruments. In calculating the net position, positions in derivative instruments shall be treated as laid down in Articles 317 to 319. Institutions' holdings of their own debt instruments shall be disregarded in calculating specific risk capital requirements under Article 325.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p144 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">No netting shall be allowed between a convertible and an offsetting position in the instrument underlying it, unless the competent authorities adopt an approach under which the likelihood of a particular convertible's being converted is taken into account or require an own funds requirement to cover any loss which conversion might entail. Such approaches or own funds requirements shall be notified to the EBA. EBA shall monitor the range of practices in this area and shall, in accordance with Article 16 of Regulation (EU) No. 1093/2010, issue guidelines.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p145 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">All net positions, irrespective of their signs, must be converted on a daily basis into the institution's reporting currency at the prevailing spot exchange rate before their aggregation.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p31 ft8">Article 317</P>
<P class="p146 ft8">Interest rate futures and forwards</P>
<P class="p33 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><NOBR><SPAN class="ft9">Interest-rate</SPAN></NOBR> futures, <NOBR>forward-rate</NOBR> agreements (FRAs) and forward commitments to buy or sell debt instruments shall be treated as combinations of long and short positions. Thus a long <NOBR>interest-rate</NOBR> futures position shall be treated as a combination of a borrowing maturing on the delivery date of the futures contract and a holding of an asset with maturity date equal to that of the instrument or notional position underlying the futures contract in question. Similarly a sold FRA will be treated as a long position with a maturity date equal to the settlement date plus the contract period, and a short position with maturity equal to the settlement date. Both the borrowing and the asset holding shall be included in the first category set out in Table 1 in</P>
<P class="p147 ft1">16</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_18">


<P class="p148 ft1">Article 325 in order to calculate the own funds requirement for specific risk for <NOBR>interest-rate</NOBR> futures and FRAs. A forward commitment to buy a debt instrument shall be treated as a combination of a borrowing maturing on the delivery date and a long (spot) position in the debt instrument itself. The borrowing shall be included in the first category set out in Table 1 in Article 325 for purposes of specific risk, and the debt instrument under whichever column is appropriate for it in the same table.</P>
<P class="p149 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">For the purposes of this Article, long position means a position in which an institution has fixed the interest rate it will receive at some time in the future, and short position means a position in which it has fixed the interest rate it will pay at some time in the future.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p95 ft8">Article 318</P>
<P class="p150 ft8">Options and warrants</P>
<P class="p33 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Options and warrants on interest rates, debt instruments, equities, equity indices, financial futures, swaps and foreign currencies shall be treated as if they were positions equal in value to the amount of the underlying instrument to which the option refers, multiplied by its delta for the purposes of this Chapter. The latter positions may be netted off against any offsetting positions in the identical underlying securities or derivatives. The delta used shall, where relevant, be that of the exchange concerned, that calculated by the competent authorities or, subject to permission by the competent authorities, where that is not available or for OTC- options, that calculated by the institution itself using an appropriate model. Permission shall be granted if the model appropriately estimates the rate of change of the option's or warrant's value with respect to small changes in the market price of the underlying.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p151 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Institutions shall adequately reflect other risks, apart from the delta risk, associated with options in the own funds requirements.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p18 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">EBA shall develop draft regulatory technical standards defining a range of methods to reflect in the own funds requirements other risks, apart from delta risk, referred to in paragraph 2 in a manner proportionate to the scale and complexity of institutions' activities in options and warrants.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p152 ft1">EBA shall submit those draft regulatory technical standards to the Commission by 1 January 2013.</P>
<P class="p153 ft1">Power is delegated to the Commission to adopt the regulatory technical standards referred to in the first <NOBR>sub-paragraph</NOBR> in accordance with Articles 10 to 14 of Regulation (EU) No 1093/2010.</P>
<P class="p44 ft8">Article 319</P>
<P class="p154 ft8">Swaps</P>
<P class="p46 ft1">Swaps shall be treated for <NOBR>interest-rate</NOBR> risk purposes on the same basis as <NOBR>on-balance-sheet</NOBR> instruments. Thus, an <NOBR>interest-rate</NOBR> swap under which an institution receives <NOBR>floating-rate</NOBR> interest and pays <NOBR>fixed-rate</NOBR> interest shall be treated as equivalent to a long position in a <NOBR>floating-rate</NOBR> instrument of maturity equivalent to the period until the next interest fixing and a short position in a <NOBR>fixed-rate</NOBR> instrument with the same maturity as the swap itself.</P>
<P class="p155 ft1">17</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_19">


<P class="p26 ft8">Article 320</P>
<P class="p156 ft8">Interest rate risk on derivative instruments</P>
<P class="p33 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Institutions which mark to market and manage the </SPAN><NOBR>interest-rate</NOBR> risk on the derivative instruments covered in Articles 317 to 319 on a <NOBR>discounted-cash-flow</NOBR> basis may, subject to permission by the competent authorities, use sensitivity models to calculate the positions referred to in those points and may use them for any bond which is amortised over its residual life rather than via one final repayment of principal. Permission shall be granted if these models generate positions which have the same sensitivity to <NOBR>interest-rate</NOBR> changes as the underlying cash flows. This sensitivity shall be assessed with reference to independent movements in sample rates across the yield curve, with at least one sensitivity point in each of the maturity bands set out in Table 2 in Article 328. The positions shall be included in the calculation of own funds requirements for general risk of debt instruments.</P>
<P class="p157 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Institutions which do not use models under paragraph 1 may, treat as fully offsetting any positions in derivative instruments covered in Articles 317 to 319 which meet the following conditions at least:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p158 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">the positions are of the same value and denominated in the same currency;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p159 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">the reference rate (for </SPAN><NOBR>floating-rate</NOBR> positions) or coupon (for <NOBR>fixed-rate</NOBR> positions) is closely matched;</P>
<P class="p35 ft4"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft10">the next </SPAN><NOBR>interest-fixing</NOBR> date or, for fixed coupon positions, residual maturity corresponds with the following limits:</P>
<P class="p160 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft14">less than one month hence: same day;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p59 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft15">between one month and one year hence: within seven days;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p60 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft16">over one year hence: within 30 days.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p161 ft8">Article 321</P>
<P class="p50 ft8">Credit Derivatives</P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">When calculating the own funds requirement for general and specific risk of the party who assumes the credit risk (the 'protection seller'), unless specified differently, the notional amount of the credit derivative contract shall be used. Notwithstanding the first sentence, the institution may elect to replace the notional value by the notional value plus the net market value change of the credit derivative since trade inception, a net downward change from the protection seller's perspective carrying a negative sign. For the purpose of calculating the specific risk charge, other than for total return swaps, the maturity of the credit derivative contract, rather than the maturity of the obligation, shall apply. Positions are determined as follows:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p162 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">a total return swap creates a long position in the general risk of the reference obligation and a short position in the general risk of a government bond with a maturity equivalent to the period until the next interest fixing and which is assigned a 0 % risk weight under Title II, Chapter 2. It also creates a long position in the specific risk of the reference obligation;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p163 ft1">18</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_20">


<P class="p37 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">a credit default swap does not create a position for general risk. For the purposes of specific risk, the institution must record a synthetic long position in an obligation of the reference entity, unless the derivative is rated externally and meets the conditions for a qualifying debt item, in which case a long position in the derivative is recorded. If premium or interest payments are due under the product, these cash flows must be represented as notional positions in government bonds;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">a single name credit linked note creates a long position in the general risk of the note itself, as an interest rate product. For the purpose of specific risk, a synthetic long position is created in an obligation of the reference entity. An additional long position is created in the issuer of the note. Where the credit linked note has an external rating and meets the conditions for a qualifying debt item, a single long position with the specific risk of the note need only be recorded;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p57 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">in addition to a long position in the specific risk of the issuer of the note, a multiple name credit linked note providing proportional protection creates a position in each reference entity, with the total notional amount of the contract assigned across the positions according to the proportion of the total notional amount that each exposure to a reference entity represents. Where more than one obligation of a reference entity can be selected, the obligation with the highest risk weighting determines the specific risk.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p164 ft1">Where a multiple name credit linked note has an external rating and meets the conditions for a qualifying debt item, a single long position with the specific risk of the note need only be recorded;</P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">a </SPAN><NOBR>first-asset-to-default</NOBR> credit derivative creates a position for the notional amount in an obligation of each reference entity. If the size of the maximum credit event payment is lower than the own funds requirement under the method in the first sentence of this point, the maximum payment amount may be taken as the own funds requirement for specific risk.</P>
<P class="p165 ft1">A <NOBR>second-asset-to-default</NOBR> credit derivative creates a position for the notional amount in an obligation of each reference entity less one (that with the lowest specific risk own funds requirement). If the size of the maximum credit event payment is lower than the own funds requirement under the method in the first sentence of this point, this amount may be taken as the own funds requirement for specific risk.</P>
<P class="p166 ft1">Where an <NOBR>n-th-to-default</NOBR> credit derivative is externally rated, the protection seller shall calculate the specific risk own funds requirement using the rating of the derivative and apply the respective securitisation risk weights as applicable;</P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">For the party who transfers credit risk (the protection buyer), the positions are determined as the mirror principle of the protection seller, with the exception of a credit linked note (which entails no short position in the issuer). When calculating the own funds requirement for the 'protection buyer', the notional amount of the credit derivative contract shall be used. Notwithstanding the first sentence, the institution may elect to replace the notional value by the notional value minus the net any market value changes of the credit derivative since trade inception, a net downward change from the protection buyer's perspective carrying a negative sign. If at a given moment there is a call option in combination with a </SPAN><NOBR>step-up,</NOBR> such moment is treated as the maturity of the protection.</P>
<P class="p167 ft1">19</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_21">
<DIV id="dimg1">
<INGENBILD zsrc="GZB645221x1.jpg/" id="img1">
</DIV>


<P class="p168 ft8">Article 322</P>
<P class="p27 ft8">Securities sold under a repurchase agreement or lent</P>
<P class="p169 ft1">The transferor of securities or guaranteed rights relating to title to securities in a repurchase agreement and the lender of securities in a securities lending shall include these securities in the calculation of its own funds requirement under this Chapter provided that such securities are trading book positions.</P>
<P class="p170 ft33"><SPAN class="ft32">S</SPAN>ECTION <SPAN class="ft32">2</SPAN></P>
<P class="p171 ft33"><SPAN class="ft32">D</SPAN>EBT INSTRUMENTS</P>
<P class="p172 ft8">Article 323</P>
<P class="p173 ft8">Net positions in debt instruments</P>
<P class="p169 ft1">Net positions shall be classified according to the currency in which they are denominated and shall calculate the own funds requirement for general and specific risk in each individual currency separately.</P>
<P class="p174 ft33"><NOBR><SPAN class="ft32">S</SPAN>UB<SPAN class="ft32">-</SPAN>SECTION</NOBR> <SPAN class="ft32">1</SPAN></P>
<P class="p175 ft33"><SPAN class="ft32">S</SPAN>PECIFIC RISK</P>
<P class="p172 ft8">Article 324</P>
<P class="p176 ft8">Cap on the own funds requirement for a net position</P>
<P class="p169 ft1">The institution may cap the own funds requirement for specific risk of a net position in a debt instrument at the maximum possible <NOBR>default-risk</NOBR> related loss. For a short position, that limit may be calculated as a change in value due to the instrument or, where relevant, the underlying names immediately becoming default <NOBR>risk-free.</NOBR></P>
<P class="p68 ft8">Article 325</P>
<P class="p177 ft8">Own funds requirement for <NOBR>non-securitisation</NOBR> debt instruments</P>
<P class="p86 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The institution shall assign its net positions in the trading book in instruments that are not securitisation positions as calculated in accordance with Article 316 to the appropriate categories in Table 1 on the basis of their issuer or obligor, external or internal credit assessment, and residual maturity, and then multiply them by the weightings shown in that table. It shall sum its weighted positions resulting from the application of this point regardless of whether they are long or short in order to calculate its own funds requirement against specific risk.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p178 ft8">Table 1</P>

</TR>

<TD class="tr4 td76"><P class="p9 ft18"> </P></TD>

</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="tr5 td81"><P class="p74 ft1">the Standardised approach for credit risk and other qualifying items as</P></TD>
<TD colspan=3 class="tr5 td82"><P class="p75 ft1">final maturity six months or</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="tr6 td81"><P class="p74 ft1">defined in paragraph 6.</P></TD>
<TD class="tr6 td83"><P class="p75 ft1">less)</P></TD>
<TD class="tr6 td84"><P class="p9 ft18"> </P></TD>
<TD class="tr6 td85"><P class="p9 ft18"> </P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="tr11 td81"><P class="p9 ft18"> </P></TD>
<TD colspan=3 class="tr11 td82"><P class="p75 ft1">1,00 % (residual term to</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="tr5 td81"><P class="p9 ft18"> </P></TD>
<TD colspan=2 class="tr5 td86"><P class="p75 ft1">final maturity greater</P></TD>
<TD class="tr5 td85"><P class="p79 ft1">than</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="tr10 td81"><P class="p9 ft21"> </P></TD>
<TD colspan=3 class="tr10 td82"><P class="p75 ft22">six months and up to and</P></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
<TD class="tr2 td81"><P class="p74 ft1">Standardised approach for credit risk.</P></TD>
<TD class="tr2 td83"><P class="p9 ft18"> </P></TD>

<TD class="tr2 td85"><P class="p9 ft18"> </P></TD>
</TR>

<TD class="tr7 td79"><P class="p9 ft20"> </P></TD>

<TD class="tr7 td89"><P class="p9 ft20"> </P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="tr4 td81"><P class="p74 ft1">Debt which would receive a 150% risk weight under the Standardised</P></TD>
<TD class="tr4 td83"><P class="p75 ft1">12,00 %</P></TD>
<TD class="tr4 td84"><P class="p9 ft18"> </P></TD>

</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="tr2 td81"><P class="p74 ft1">approach for credit risk.</P></TD>

<TD class="tr2 td85"><P class="p9 ft18"> </P></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
<P class="p180 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">For institutions which apply the IRB approach to the exposure class of which the issuer of the debt instrument forms part, to qualify for a risk weight under the Standardised approach for credit risk as referred to in paragraph 1, the issuer of the exposure shall have an internal rating with a PD equivalent to or lower than that associated with the appropriate credit quality step under the Standardised approach.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p72 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Institutions may calculate the specific risk requirements for any bonds that qualify for a 10% risk weight in accordance with the treatment in Article 124(3) as half of the applicable specific risk own funds requirement for the second category in Table 1.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p87 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Other qualifying items are:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p181 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">long and short positions in assets qualifying for a credit quality step corresponding at least to investment grade in the mapping process under the Standardised approach for credit risk;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p182 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">long and short positions in assets which, because of the solvency of the issuer, have a PD under the IRB approach for credit risk, which is not higher than that of the assets referred to under (a);</SPAN></P>
<P class="p90 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">long and short positions in assets for which a credit assessment by a nominated external credit assessment institution is not available and which meet all of the following conditions:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p183 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft14">they are considered by the institution concerned to be sufficiently liquid;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p184 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft15">their investment quality is, according to the institution's own discretion, at least equivalent to that of the assets referred to under point (a);</SPAN></P>
<P class="p185 ft1">21</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_23">


<P class="p186 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft16">they are listed on at least one regulated market in a Member State or on a stock exchange in a third country provided that the exchange is recognised by the competent authorities of the relevant Member State;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p35 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">long and short positions in assets issued by institutions subject to the own funds requirements set out in this Regulation which are considered by the institution concerned to be sufficiently liquid and whose investment quality is, according to the institution's own discretion, at least equivalent to that of the assets referred to under point (a);</SPAN></P>
<P class="p35 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">securities issued by institutions that are deemed to be of equivalent, or higher, credit quality than those associated with credit quality step 2 under the Standardised approach for credit risk of exposures to institutions and that are subject to supervisory and regulatory arrangements comparable to those under this Directive.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p17 ft1">Institutions that make use of points (c) or (d) shall have a documented methodology in place to assess whether assets meet the requirements in those points and shall notify this methodology to the competent authorities.</P>
<P class="p95 ft8">Article 326</P>
<P class="p187 ft8">Own funds requirement for securitisation instruments</P>
<P class="p28 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">For instruments in the trading book that are securitisation positions, the institution shall weight with the following its net positions as calculated in accordance with Article 316(1):</SPAN></P>
<P class="p35 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">for securitisation positions that would be subject to the Standardised Approach for credit risk in the same institution's </SPAN><NOBR>non-trading</NOBR> book, 8 % of the risk weight under the Standardised Approach as set out in Chapter 5;</P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">for securitisation positions that would be subject to the Internal Ratings Based Approach in the same institution's </SPAN><NOBR>non-trading</NOBR> book, 8 % of the risk weight under the Internal Ratings Based Approach as set out in Chapter 5.</P>
<P class="p18 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The Supervisory Formula Method set out in Article 257 may be used where the institution can produce estimates of PD, and where applicable EAD and LGD as inputs into the Supervisory Formula Method in accordance with the requirements for the estimation of those parameters under the Internal Ratings Based approach in accordance with Chapter 2, Section 3.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p19 ft1">An institution other than an originator institution that could apply it for the same securitisation position in its <NOBR>non-trading</NOBR> book may only use that method subject to permission by the competent authorities, which shall be granted where the institution fulfils the condition in the previous sentence.</P>
<P class="p152 ft1">Estimates of PD and LGD as inputs to the Supervisory Formula Method may alternatively also be determined based on estimates that are derived from an IRC approach of an institution that has been granted permission to use an internal model for specific risk of debt instruments. The latter alternative may be used only subject to permission by the competent authorities, which shall be granted if those estimates meet the quantitative requirements for the Internal Ratings Based Approach set out in Chapter 2, Section 3.</P>
<P class="p188 ft1">22</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_24">


<P class="p148 ft1">In accordance with Article 16 of Regulation (EU) No. 1093/2010, EBA shall issue guidelines on the use of estimates of PD and LGD as inputs when those estimates are based on an IRC approach.</P>
<P class="p114 ft4"><SPAN class="ft1">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft17">For securitisation positions that are subject to an additional risk weight in accordance with Article 396, 8 % of the total risk weight shall be applied.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p119 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The institution shall sum its weighted positions resulting from the application of this Article (regardless of whether they are long or short) in order to calculate its own funds requirement against specific risk.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p114 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">By way of derogation from paragraph 4, for a transitional period ending 31 December 2013, the institution shall sum separately its weighted net long positions and its weighted net short positions. The larger of those sums shall constitute the specific risk own funds requirement. The institution shall, however, quarterly report to the home Member State competent authority the total sum of its weighted net long and net short positions, broken down by types of underlying assets.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p105 ft8">Article 327</P>
<P class="p189 ft8">Own funds requirement for the correlation trading portfolio</P>
<P class="p33 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The correlation trading portfolio shall consist of securitisation positions and </SPAN><NOBR>n-th-to-default</NOBR> credit derivatives that meet all of the following criteria:</P>
<P class="p35 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">the positions are neither </SPAN><NOBR>re-securitisation</NOBR> positions, nor options on a securitisation tranche, nor any other derivatives of securitisation exposures that do not provide a pro- rata share in the proceeds of a securitisation tranche;</P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">all reference instruments are either of the following:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p190 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(i)</SPAN><NOBR><SPAN class="ft14">single-name</SPAN></NOBR> instruments, including <NOBR>single-name</NOBR> credit derivatives, for which a liquid <NOBR>two-way</NOBR> market exists;</P>
<P class="p60 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(ii)</SPAN><NOBR><SPAN class="ft15">commonly-traded</SPAN></NOBR> indices based on those reference entities.</P>
<P class="p24 ft1">A <NOBR>two-way</NOBR> market is deemed to exist where there are independent bona fide offers to buy and sell so that a price reasonably related to the last sales price or current bona fide competitive bid and offer quotations can be determined within one day and settled at such price within a relatively short time conforming to trade custom.</P>
<P class="p18 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Positions which reference any of the following shall not be part of the correlation trading portfolio:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p34 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">an underlying that is capable of being assigned to the exposure class 'retail claims or contingent retail claims' or to the exposure class 'claims or contingent claims secured by mortgages on immovable property' under the Standardised approach for credit risk in an institution's </SPAN><NOBR>non-trading</NOBR> book;</P>
<P class="p191 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">a claim on a special purpose entity.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p192 ft1">23</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_25">


<P class="p193 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">An institution may include in the correlation trading portfolio positions which are neither securitisation positions nor </SPAN><NOBR>n-th-to-default</NOBR> credit derivatives but which hedge other positions of that portfolio, provided that a liquid <NOBR>two-way</NOBR> market as described in the last subparagraph of paragraph 1 exists for the instrument or its underlyings instead of determining it as the sum of those amounts.</P>
<P class="p149 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">An institution shall determine the larger of the following amounts as the specific risk own funds requirement for the correlation trading portfolio:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">the total specific risk own funds requirement that would apply just to the net long positions of the correlation trading portfolio;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">the total specific risk own funds requirement that would apply just to the net short positions of the correlation trading portfolio.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p194 ft33"><NOBR><SPAN class="ft32">S</SPAN>UB<SPAN class="ft32">-</SPAN>SECTION</NOBR> <SPAN class="ft32">2</SPAN></P>
<P class="p195 ft33"><SPAN class="ft32">G</SPAN>ENERAL RISK</P>
<P class="p105 ft8">Article 328</P>
<P class="p196 ft8"><NOBR>Maturity-based</NOBR> calculation of general risk</P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">In order to calculate own funds requirements against general risk all positions shall be weighted according to maturity as explained in paragraph 2 in order to compute the amount of own funds required against them. This requirement shall be reduced when a weighted position is held alongside an opposite weighted position within the same maturity band. A reduction in the requirement shall also be made when the opposite weighted positions fall into different maturity bands, with the size of this reduction depending both on whether the two positions fall into the same zone, or not, and on the particular zones they fall into.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p197 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The institution shall assign its net positions to the appropriate maturity bands in column 2 or 3, as appropriate, in Table 2 in paragraph 4. It shall do so on the basis of residual maturity in the case of </SPAN><NOBR>fixed-rate</NOBR> instruments and on the basis of the period until the interest rate is next set in the case of instruments on which the interest rate is variable before final maturity. It shall also</P>
<P class="p148 ft1">distinguish between debt instruments with a coupon of 3 % or more and those with a coupon of less than 3 % and thus allocate them to column 2 or column 3 in Table 2. It shall then multiply each of them by the weighing for the maturity band in question in column 4 in Table 2.</P>
<P class="p145 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The institution shall then work out the sum of the weighted long positions and the sum of the weighted short positions in each maturity band. The amount of the former which are matched by the latter in a given maturity band shall be the matched weighted position in that band, while the residual long or short position shall be the unmatched weighted position for the same band. The total of the matched weighted positions in all bands shall then be calculated.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p119 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The institution shall compute the totals of the unmatched weighted long positions for the bands included in each of the zones in Table 2 in order to derive the unmatched weighted long position for each zone. Similarly, the sum of the unmatched weighted short positions for each band in a particular zone shall be summed to compute the unmatched weighted short position</SPAN></P>
<P class="p198 ft1">24</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_26">
<DIV id="dimg1">
<INGENBILD zsrc="GZB645226x1.jpg/" id="img1">
</DIV>


<P class="p199 ft1">for that zone. That part of the unmatched weighted long position for a given zone that is matched by the unmatched weighted short position for the same zone shall be the matched weighted position for that zone. That part of the unmatched weighted long or unmatched weighted short position for a zone that cannot be thus matched shall be the unmatched weighted position for that zone.</P>

<P class="p180 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The amount of the unmatched weighted long or short position in zone one which is matched by the unmatched weighted short or long position in zone two shall then be the matched weighted position between zones one and two. The same calculation shall then be undertaken with regard to that part of the unmatched weighted position in zone two which is left over and the unmatched weighted position in zone three in order to calculate the matched weighted position between zones two and three.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p201 ft1">25</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_27">
<DIV id="dimg1">
<INGENBILD zsrc="GZB645227x1.jpg/" id="img1">
</DIV>


<P class="p193 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">6.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The institution may reverse the order in paragraph 5 so as to calculate the matched weighted position between zones two and three before calculating that position between zones one and two.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p114 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">7.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The remainder of the unmatched weighted position in zone one shall then be matched with what remains of that for zone three after the latter's matching with zone two in order to derive the matched weighted position between zones one and three.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">8.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Residual positions, following the three separate matching calculations in paragraph 5, 6 and 7 shall be summed.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p38 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">9.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The institution's own funds requirement shall be calculated as the sum of:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p202 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">10 % of the sum of the matched weighted positions in all maturity bands;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">40 % of the matched weighted position in zone one;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p202 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">30 % of the matched weighted position in zone two;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">30 % of the matched weighted position in zone three;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p21 ft4"><SPAN class="ft1">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft10">40 % of the matched weighted position between zones one and two and between zones two and three;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p30 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft30">150 % of the matched weighted position between zones one and three;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p202 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(g)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">100 % of the residual unmatched weighted positions.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p31 ft8">Article 329</P>
<P class="p156 ft8"><NOBR>Duration-based</NOBR> calculation of general risk</P>
<P class="p33 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Institutions may use an approach for calculating the own funds requirement for the general risk on debt instruments which reflects duration, instead of the approach set out in Article 328, provided that the institution does so on a consistent basis.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p18 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Under the </SPAN><NOBR>duration-based</NOBR> approach referred to in paragraph 1, the institution shall take the market value of each <NOBR>fixed-rate</NOBR> debt instrument and hence calculate its yield to maturity, which is implied discount rate for that instrument. In the case of <NOBR>floating-rate</NOBR> instruments, the institution shall take the market value of each instrument and hence calculate its yield on the assumption that the principal is due when the interest rate can next be changed.</P>
<P class="p119 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The institution shall then calculate the modified duration of each debt instrument on the basis of the following formula:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p203 ft8">modified duration <SPAN class="ft40">= </SPAN><SPAN class="ft41">1 </SPAN><SPAN class="ft42">+</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">D</SPAN><SPAN class="ft44">R</SPAN></P>
<P class="p204 ft1">where:</P>
<P class="p205 ft1"><SPAN class="ft8">D </SPAN>= duration calculated according to the following formula:</P>
<P class="p206 ft1">26</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_28">
<DIV id="dimg1">
<INGENBILD zsrc="GZB645228x1.jpg/" id="img1">
</DIV>


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t6">
<TR>
<TD class="tr16 td106"><P class="p9 ft26"> </P></TD>
<TD class="tr16 td107"><P class="p207 ft45">M</P></TD>
<TD rowspan=2 class="tr4 td108"><P class="p208 ft8">t C<SPAN class="ft46">t</SPAN></P></TD>
<TD class="tr16 td109"><P class="p9 ft26"> </P></TD>
</TR>

<TD rowspan=2 class="tr6 td108"><P class="p209 ft1">(1<SPAN class="ft40">+ </SPAN><SPAN class="ft8">R</SPAN>)</P></TD>
<TD class="tr29 td109"><P class="p9 ft45">t</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="tr29 td111"><P class="p209 ft49">t<SPAN class="ft47">=</SPAN><SPAN class="ft48">1</SPAN></P></TD>
<TD class="tr29 td110"><P class="p9 ft50"> </P></TD>

<TD rowspan=2 class="tr2 td108"><P class="p208 ft52">C<SPAN class="ft46">t</SPAN></P></TD>
<TD class="tr27 td109"><P class="p9 ft38"> </P></TD>

<TD rowspan=2 class="tr30 td106"><P class="p9 ft18"> </P></TD>
