<TD class="tr13 td110"><P class="p9 ft23"> </P></TD>
</TR>

<TD rowspan=2 class="tr24 td112"><P class="p209 ft1">(1<SPAN class="ft40">+ </SPAN><SPAN class="ft8">R</SPAN>)</P></TD>
<TD class="tr29 td109"><P class="p9 ft45">t</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="tr13 td106"><P class="p9 ft23"> </P></TD>
<TD class="tr13 td107"><P class="p209 ft45">t<SPAN class="ft53">=</SPAN><SPAN class="ft48">1</SPAN></P></TD>
<TD class="tr13 td109"><P class="p9 ft23"> </P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p210 ft1">where:</P>
<P class="p205 ft1">R = yield to maturity referred to in paragraph 2;</P>
<P class="p205 ft1">C<SPAN class="ft54">t </SPAN>= cash payment in time t;</P>
<P class="p56 ft1">M = total maturity referred to in paragraph 2.</P>
<P class="p24 ft1">Correction shall be made to the calculation of the modified duration for debt instruments which are subject to prepayment risk. EBA shall, in accordance with Article 16 of Regulation (EU) No. 1093/2010, issue guidelines about how to apply such corrections.</P>
<P class="p18 ft4"><SPAN class="ft1">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft17">The institution shall then allocate each debt instrument to the appropriate zone in Table 3. It shall do so on the basis of the modified duration of each instrument.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p211 ft1">Table 3</P>
<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t7">
<TR>
<TD class="tr1 td113"><P class="p74 ft1">Zone</P></TD>
<TD class="tr1 td114"><P class="p75 ft1">Modified duration</P></TD>

<TD class="tr1 td117"><P class="p75 ft1">> 0 <SPAN class="ft39">= </SPAN>1,0</P></TD>

<TD class="tr8 td116"><P class="p74 ft1">Two</P></TD>
<TD class="tr8 td117"><P class="p75 ft1">> 1,0 <SPAN class="ft39">= </SPAN>3,6</P></TD>
<TD class="tr8 td118"><P class="p128 ft1">0,85</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="tr3 td119"><P class="p9 ft19"> </P></TD>
<TD class="tr3 td120"><P class="p9 ft19"> </P></TD>
<TD class="tr3 td121"><P class="p9 ft19"> </P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="tr1 td116"><P class="p74 ft1">Three</P></TD>
<TD class="tr1 td117"><P class="p75 ft1">> 3,6</P></TD>
<TD class="tr1 td118"><P class="p128 ft1">0,7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="tr3 td119"><P class="p9 ft19"> </P></TD>
<TD class="tr3 td120"><P class="p9 ft19"> </P></TD>
<TD class="tr3 td121"><P class="p9 ft19"> </P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p212 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The institution shall then calculate the </SPAN><NOBR>duration-weighted</NOBR> position for each instrument by multiplying its market price by its modified duration and by the assumed <NOBR>interest-rate</NOBR> change for an instrument with that particular modified duration (see column 3 in Table 3).</P>
<P class="p18 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">6.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The institution shall calculate its </SPAN><NOBR>duration-weighted</NOBR> long and its <NOBR>duration-weighted</NOBR> short positions within each zone. The amount of the former which are matched by the latter within each zone shall be the matched <NOBR>duration-weighted</NOBR> position for that zone.</P>
<P class="p17 ft1">The institution shall then calculate the unmatched <NOBR>duration-weighted</NOBR> positions for each zone. It shall then follow the procedures laid down for unmatched weighted positions in paragraphs 5 to 8.</P>
<P class="p213 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">7.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The institution's own funds requirement shall then be calculated as the sum of the following:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">2 % of the matched </SPAN><NOBR>duration-weighted</NOBR> position for each zone;</P>
<P class="p188 ft1">27</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_29">


<P class="p37 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">40 % of the matched </SPAN><NOBR>duration-weighted</NOBR> positions between zones one and two and between zones two and three;</P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">150 % of the matched </SPAN><NOBR>duration-weighted</NOBR> position between zones one and three;</P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">100 % of the residual unmatched </SPAN><NOBR>duration-weighted</NOBR> positions.</P>
<P class="p214 ft33"><SPAN class="ft32">S</SPAN>ECTION <SPAN class="ft32">3</SPAN></P>
<P class="p215 ft33"><SPAN class="ft32">E</SPAN>QUITIES</P>
<P class="p141 ft8">Article 330</P>
<P class="p216 ft8">Net positions in equity instruments</P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The institution shall separately sum all its net long positions and all its net short positions in accordance with Article 316. The sum of the absolute values of the two figures shall be its overall gross position.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p217 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The institution shall calculate, separately for each market, the difference between the sum of the net long and the net short positions. The sum of the absolute values of those differences shall be its overall net position.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p218 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">EBA shall develop draft regulatory technical standards defining the term market referred to in paragraph 2.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p24 ft1">EBA shall submit those draft regulatory technical standards to the Commission by 1 January 2013.</P>
<P class="p152 ft1">Power is delegated to the Commission to adopt the regulatory technical standards referred to in the previous <NOBR>sub-paragraph</NOBR> in accordance with the procedure laid down in Articles 10 to 14 of Regulation (EU) No 1093/2010.</P>
<P class="p31 ft8">Article 331</P>
<P class="p146 ft8">Specific risk of equity instruments</P>
<P class="p219 ft4">The institution shall multiply its overall gross position by 8 % in order to calculate its own funds requirement against specific risk.</P>
<P class="p220 ft8">Article 332</P>
<P class="p221 ft8">General risk of equity instruments</P>
<P class="p100 ft1">The own funds requirement against general risk shall be its overall net position multiplied by 8 %.</P>
<P class="p161 ft8">Article 333</P>
<P class="p222 ft8">Stock indices</P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">EBA shall develop draft implementing technical standards listing the stock indices for which one or more of the treatments in paragraphs 3 and 4 is available.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p223 ft1">28</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_30">
<DIV id="dimg1">
<INGENBILD zsrc="GZB645230x1.jpg/" id="img1">
</DIV>


<P class="p224 ft1">EBA shall submit those draft technical standards to the Commission by 1 January 2014.</P>
<P class="p225 ft1">Power is conferred on the Commission to adopt the implementing technical standards referred to in the third subparagraph in accordance with the procedure laid down in Article 15 of Regulation (EU) No 1093/2010.</P>
<P class="p18 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Before the entry into force of the technical standards referred to in paragraph 1, institutions may continue to apply the treatment set out in paragraphs 3 and 4, where the competent authorities have applied that treatment before 1 January 2013.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p18 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">3.</SPAN><NOBR><SPAN class="ft9">Stock-index</SPAN></NOBR> futures, the <NOBR>delta-weighted</NOBR> equivalents of options in <NOBR>stock-index</NOBR> futures and stock indices collectively referred to hereafter as <NOBR>stock-index</NOBR> futures, may be broken down into positions in each of their constituent equities. These positions may be treated as underlying positions in the equities in question, and may, be netted against opposite positions in the underlying equities themselves. Institutions shall notify the competent authority of the use they make of this treatment.</P>
<P class="p145 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Where a </SPAN><NOBR>stock-index</NOBR> future is not broken down into its underlying positions, it shall be treated as if it were an individual equity. However, the specific risk on this individual equity can be ignored if the <NOBR>stock-index</NOBR> future in question is exchange traded and represents an appropriately diversified index.</P>
<P class="p103 ft33"><SPAN class="ft32">S</SPAN>ECTION <SPAN class="ft32">4</SPAN></P>
<P class="p226 ft33"><SPAN class="ft32">U</SPAN>NDERWRITING</P>
<P class="p105 ft8">Article 334</P>
<P class="p227 ft8">Reduction of net positions</P>
<P class="p33 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">In the case of the underwriting of debt and equity instruments, an institution may use the following procedure in calculating its own funds requirements. The institution shall first calculate the net positions by deducting the underwriting positions which are subscribed or </SPAN><NOBR>sub-underwritten</NOBR> by third parties on the basis of formal agreements. The institution shall then reduce the net positions by the reduction factors in Table 4 and calculate its own funds requirements using the reduced underwriting positions.</P>
<P class="p228 ft1">Table 4</P>
<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t8">

<TD class="tr1 td127"><P class="p128 ft1">25 %</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="tr3 td124"><P class="p9 ft19"> </P></TD>
<TD class="tr3 td125"><P class="p9 ft19"> </P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="tr1 td126"><P class="p74 ft1">after working day 5:</P></TD>
<TD class="tr1 td127"><P class="p128 ft1">0 %.</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="tr3 td124"><P class="p9 ft19"> </P></TD>
<TD class="tr3 td125"><P class="p9 ft19"> </P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD class="tr25 td128"><P class="p230 ft1">29</P></TD>
<TD class="tr25 td127"><P class="p9 ft18"> </P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_31">


<P class="p231 ft1">Working day zero shall be the working day on which the institution becomes unconditionally committed to accepting a known quantity of securities at an agreed price.</P>
<P class="p107 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The institutions shall notify to the competent authorities the use they make of paragraph 1.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p214 ft33"><SPAN class="ft32">S</SPAN>ECTION <SPAN class="ft32">5</SPAN></P>
<P class="p232 ft33"><SPAN class="ft32">S</SPAN>PECIFIC RISK OWN FUNDS REQUIREMENTS FOR POSITIONS HEDGED BY CREDIT</P>
<P class="p233 ft33">DERIVATIVES</P>
<P class="p44 ft8">Article 335</P>
<P class="p156 ft8">Allowance for hedges by credit derivatives</P>
<P class="p33 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">An allowance shall be given for hedges provided by credit derivatives, in accordance with the principles set out in paragraphs 2 to 6.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p18 ft4"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft17">Institutions shall treat the position in the credit derivative as one 'leg' and the hedged position that has the same nominal, or, where applicable, notional amount, as the other 'leg'.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p119 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Full allowance shall be given when the values of the two legs always move in the opposite direction and broadly to the same extent. This will be the case in the following situations:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">the two legs consist of completely identical instruments;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">a long cash position is hedged by a total rate of return swap (or vice versa) and there is an exact match between the reference obligation and the underlying exposure (i.e., the cash position). The maturity of the swap itself may be different from that of the underlying exposure.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p234 ft1">In these situations, a specific risk own funds requirement shall not be applied to either side of the position.</P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">An 80 % offset will be applied when the values of the two legs always move in the opposite direction and where there is an exact match in terms of the reference obligation, the maturity of both the reference obligation and the credit derivative, and the currency of the underlying exposure. In addition, key features of the credit derivative contract shall not cause the price movement of the credit derivative to materially deviate from the price movements of the cash position. To the extent that the transaction transfers risk, an 80 % specific risk offset will be applied to the side of the transaction with the higher own funds requirement, while the specific risk requirements on the other side shall be zero.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p197 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Partial allowance shall be given, absent the situations in paragraphs 3 and 4, in the following situations:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p115 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">the position falls under paragraph 2(b) but there is an asset mismatch between the reference obligation and the underlying exposure. However, the positions meet the following requirements:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p235 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft14">the reference obligation ranks pari passu with or is junior to the underlying obligation;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p163 ft1">30</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_32">


<P class="p186 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft15">the underlying obligation and reference obligation share the same obligor and have legally enforceable </SPAN><NOBR>cross-default</NOBR> or <NOBR>cross-acceleration</NOBR> clauses;</P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">the position falls under paragraph 2(b) or 3 but there is a currency or maturity mismatch between the credit protection and the underlying asset. Such currency mismatch shall be included in the own funds requirement for foreign exchange risk;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p35 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">the position falls under paragraph 3 but there is an asset mismatch between the cash position and the credit derivative. However, the underlying asset is included in the (deliverable) obligations in the credit derivative documentation.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p236 ft4">In order to give partial allowance, rather than adding the specific risk own funds requirements for each side of the transaction, only the higher of the two own funds requirements shall apply.</P>
<P class="p119 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">6.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">In all situations not falling under paragraphs 3 to 5, an own funds requirement for specific risk shall be calculated for both sides of the positions separately.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p31 ft8">Article 336</P>
<P class="p237 ft8">Allowance for hedges by first and <NOBR>nth-to</NOBR> default credit derivatives</P>
<P class="p238 ft1">In the case of <NOBR>first-to-default</NOBR> credit derivatives and <NOBR>nth-to-default</NOBR> credit derivatives, the following treatment applies for the allowance to be given according to Article 335:</P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">where an institution obtains credit protection for a number of reference entities underlying a credit derivative under the terms that the first default among the assets shall trigger payment and that this credit event shall terminate the contract, the institution may offset specific risk for the reference entity to which the lowest specific risk percentage charge among the underlying reference entities applies according to Table 1 in Article 325;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p119 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">where the nth default among the exposures triggers payment under the credit protection, the protection buyer may only offset specific risk if protection has also been obtained for defaults 1 to </SPAN><NOBR>n-1</NOBR> or when <NOBR>n-1</NOBR> defaults have already occurred. In such cases, the methodology set out above for <NOBR>first-to-default</NOBR> credit derivatives shall be followed appropriately modified for nth- <NOBR>to-default</NOBR> products.</P>
<P class="p239 ft33"><SPAN class="ft32">S</SPAN>ECTION <SPAN class="ft32">6</SPAN></P>
<P class="p240 ft33"><SPAN class="ft32">O</SPAN>WN FUNDS REQUIREMENTS FOR <SPAN class="ft32">CIU</SPAN>S</P>
<P class="p105 ft8">Article 337</P>
<P class="p221 ft8">Own funds requirements for CIUs</P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Without prejudice to other provisions in this section, positions in CIUs shall be subject to an own funds requirement for position risk, comprising specific and general risk, of 32 %. Without prejudice to Article 342 or Article 356(6) taken together with Article 342 where the modified gold treatment set out in those points is used, positions in CIUs shall be subject to an own funds requirement for position risk, comprising specific and general risk, and foreign- exchange risk of 40 %.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p241 ft1">31</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_33">


<P class="p193 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Unless noted otherwise in Article 339, no netting is permitted between the underlying investments of a CIU and other positions held by the institution.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p31 ft8">Article 338</P>
<P class="p242 ft8">General criteria for CIUs</P>
<P class="p238 ft1">CIUs shall be eligible for the approach set out in Article 339, where all the following conditions are met:</P>
<P class="p243 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the CIU's prospectus or equivalent document shall include all of the following:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft14">the categories of assets the CIU is authorised to invest in;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft15">where investment limits apply, the relative limits and the methodologies to calculate them;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p244 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft16">where leverage is allowed, the maximum level of leverage;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p39 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(iv)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft55">where concluding OTC financial derivatives transactions or repurchase transactions or securities borrowing or lending is allowed, a policy to limit counterparty risk arising from these transactions;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p18 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the business of the CIU shall be reported in </SPAN><NOBR>half-yearly</NOBR> and annual reports to enable an assessment to be made of the assets and liabilities, income and operations over the reporting period;</P>
<P class="p245 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the shares or units of the CIU are redeemable in cash, out of the undertaking's assets, on a daily basis at the request of the unit holder;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p107 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">investments in the CIU shall be segregated from the assets of the CIU manager;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p107 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">there shall be adequate risk assessment of the CIU, by the investing institution;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p33 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft34">CIUs shall be managed by persons supervised according to Directive (UCITS) or equivalent legislation in order to be eligible.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p31 ft8">Article 339</P>
<P class="p246 ft8">Specific methods for CIUs</P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Where the institution is aware of the underlying investments of the CIU on a daily basis, the institution may look through to those underlying investments in order to calculate the own funds requirements for position risk, comprising specific and general risk under this approach, positions in CIUs shall be treated as positions in the underlying investments of the CIU. Netting shall be permitted between positions in the underlying investments of the CIU and other positions held by the institution, as long as the institution holds a sufficient quantity of shares or units to allow for redemption/creation in exchange for the underlying investments.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p144 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Institutions may calculate the own funds requirements for position risk, comprising specific and general risk, for positions in CIUs by assuming positions representing those necessary to</SPAN></P>
<P class="p247 ft1">32</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_34">


<P class="p231 ft1">replicate the composition and performance of the externally generated index or fixed basket of equities or debt securities referred to in (a), subject to the following conditions:</P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">purpose of the CIU's mandate is to replicate the composition and performance of an externally generated index or fixed basket of equities or debt securities;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">a minimum correlation of 0.9 between daily price movements of the CIU and the index or basket of equities or debt securities it tracks can be clearly established over a minimum period of six months. Correlation in this context means the correlation coefficient between daily returns on the CIU and the index or basket of equities or debt securities it tracks.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p149 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Where the institution is not aware of the underlying investments of the CIU on a daily basis, the institution may calculate the own funds requirements for position risk, comprising specific and general risk, subject to the following conditions:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p35 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">it will be assumed that the CIU first invests to the maximum extent allowed under its mandate in the asset classes attracting the highest own funds requirement for specific and general risk separately, and then continues making investments in descending order until the maximum total investment limit is reached. The position in the CIU will be treated as a direct holding in the assumed position;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">institutions shall take account of the maximum indirect exposure that they could achieve by taking leveraged positions through the CIU when calculating their own funds requirement for specific and general risk separately, by proportionally increasing the position in the CIU up to the maximum exposure to the underlying investment items resulting from the mandate;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p109 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">if the own funds requirement specific and general risk together according to this point exceed that set out in Article 337(1) the own funds requirement shall be capped at that level.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p245 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Institutions may rely on the following third parties to calculate and report own funds requirements for position risk for positions in CIUs falling under paragraphs 1 to 4, in accordance with the methods set out in this Chapter:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p40 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">the depository of the CIU provided that the CIU exclusively invests in securities and deposits all securities at this depository;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">for other CIUs, the CIU management company, provided that the CIU management company meets the criteria set out in paragraph 3(a) of Article 127.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p205 ft1">The correctness of the calculation shall be confirmed by an external auditor.</P>
<P class="p248 ft1">33</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_35">


<P class="p137 ft7">Chapter 3</P>
<P class="p249 ft7">Own funds requirements for <NOBR>foreign-exchange</NOBR> risk</P>
<P class="p44 ft8">Article 340</P>
<P class="p176 ft8">De minimis and weighting for foreign exchange risk</P>
<P class="p46 ft1">If the sum of an institution's overall net <NOBR>foreign-exchange</NOBR> position and its net gold position, calculated in accordance with the procedure set out in Article 341, including for any foreign exchange and gold positions for which own funds requirements are calculated using an internal model, exceeds 2 % of its total own funds, the institution shall calculate an own funds requirement for foreign exchange risk. The own funds requirement for foreign exchange risk shall be the sum of its overall net <NOBR>foreign-exchange</NOBR> position and its net gold position in the reporting currency, multiplied by 8 %.</P>
<P class="p220 ft8">Article 341</P>
<P class="p250 ft8">Calculation of the overall net foreign exchange risk position</P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The institution's net open position in each currency (including the reporting currency) and in gold shall be calculated as the sum of the following elements (positive or negative):</SPAN></P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">the net spot position (i.e. all asset items less all liability items, including accrued interest, in the currency in question or, for gold, the net spot position in gold);</SPAN></P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">the net forward position, which are all amounts to be received less all amounts to be paid under forward exchange and gold transactions, including currency and gold futures and the principal on currency swaps not included in the spot position;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p35 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">irrevocable guarantees and similar instruments that are certain to be called and likely to be irrecoverable;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">the net delta, or </SPAN><NOBR>delta-based,</NOBR> equivalent of the total book of <NOBR>foreign-currency</NOBR> and gold options;</P>
<P class="p244 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">the market value of other options.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p24 ft1">The delta used for purposes of point (e) shall be, where relevant, that of the exchange concerned, subject to permission by the competent authorities, where that is not available, or for OTC options, that calculated by the institution itself using an appropriate model. Permission shall be granted if the model appropriately estimates the rate of change of the option's or warrant's value with respect to small changes in the market price of the underlying.</P>
<P class="p19 ft1">The institution may include net future income/expenses not yet accrued but already fully hedged if it does so consistently.</P>
<P class="p23 ft1">The institution may break down net positions in composite currencies into the component currencies according to the quotas in force.</P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Any positions which an institution has deliberately taken in order to hedge against the adverse effect of the exchange rate on its ratios in according to Article 87(1) may, subject to</SPAN></P>
<P class="p251 ft1">34</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_36">


<P class="p148 ft1">permission by the competent authorities, be excluded from the calculation of net open currency positions. Such positions shall be of a <NOBR>non-trading</NOBR> or structural nature and any variation of the terms of their exclusion, subject to separate permission by the competent authorities. The same treatment subject to the same conditions as above may be applied to positions which an institution has which relate to items that are already deducted in the calculation of own funds.</P>
<P class="p149 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">An institution may use the net present value when calculating the net open position in each currency and in gold provided that the institution applies this approach consistently.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p18 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Net short and long positions in each currency other than the reporting currency and the net long or short position in gold shall be converted at spot rates into the reporting currency. They shall then be summed separately to form the total of the net short positions and the total of the net long positions respectively. The higher of these two totals shall be the institution's overall net </SPAN><NOBR>foreign-exchange</NOBR> position.</P>
<P class="p119 ft4"><SPAN class="ft1">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft17">Institutions shall adequately reflect other risks associated with options, apart from the delta risk, in the own funds requirements.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p119 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">6.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">EBA shall develop draft regulatory technical standards defining a range of methods to reflect in the own funds requirements other risks, apart from delta risk, in a manner proportionate to the scale and complexity of institutions' activities in options.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p17 ft1">EBA shall submit those draft regulatory technical standards to the Commission by 1 January 2013.</P>
<P class="p153 ft1">Power is delegated to the Commission to adopt the regulatory technical standards referred to in the previous <NOBR>sub-paragraph</NOBR> in accordance with the procedure laid down in Articles 10 to 14 of Regulation (EU) No 1093/2010.</P>
<P class="p31 ft8">Article 342</P>
<P class="p252 ft8">Foreign exchange risk of CIUs</P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">For the purposes of Article 341, in respect of CIUs the actual foreign exchange positions of the CIU shall be taken into account.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Institutions may rely on the following third parties' reporting of the foreign exchange positions in the CIU:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p97 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">the depository institution of the CIU provided that the CIU exclusively invests in securities and deposits all securities at this depository institution;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p35 ft4"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft13">for other CIUs, the CIU management company, provided that the CIU management company meets the criteria set out in point (a) of paragraph 3.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p253 ft1">The correctness of the calculation shall be confirmed by an external auditor.</P>
<P class="p33 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Where an institution is not aware of the foreign exchange positions in a CIU, it shall be assumed that the CIU is invested up to the maximum extent allowed under the CIU's mandate in foreign exchange and institutions shall, for trading book positions, take account of the</SPAN></P>
<P class="p120 ft1">35</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_37">


<P class="p148 ft1">maximum indirect exposure that they could achieve by taking leveraged positions through the CIU when calculating their own funds requirement for foreign exchange risk. This shall be done by proportionally increasing the position in the CIU up to the maximum exposure to the underlying investment items resulting from the investment mandate. The assumed position of the CIU in foreign exchange shall be treated as a separate currency according to the treatment of investments in gold, subject to the modification that, where the direction of the CIU's investment is available, the total long position may be added to the total long open foreign exchange position and the total short position may be added to the total short open foreign exchange position. There shall be no netting allowed between such positions prior to the calculation.</P>
<P class="p254 ft8">Article 343</P>
<P class="p255 ft8">Closely correlated currencies</P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Institutions may provide lower own funds requirements against positions in closely correlated currencies. A pair of currencies is deemed to be closely correlated only if the likelihood of a loss  calculated on the basis of daily </SPAN><NOBR>exchange-rate</NOBR> data for the preceding three or five years</P>
<P class="p148 ft1"> occurring on equal and opposite positions in such currencies over the following 10 working days, which is 4 % or less of the value of the matched position in question (valued in terms of the reporting currency) has a probability of at least 99 %, when an observation period of three years is used, or 95 %, when an observation period of five years is used. The <NOBR>own-funds</NOBR> requirement on the matched position in two closely correlated currencies shall be 4 % multiplied by the value of the matched position.</P>
<P class="p144 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">In calculating the requirements of this chapter, institutions may disregard positions in currencies, which are subject to a legally binding intergovernmental agreement to limit its variation relative to other currencies covered by the same agreement. Institutions shall calculate their matched positions in such currencies and subject them to an own funds requirement no lower than half of the maximum permissible variation laid down in the intergovernmental agreement in question in respect of the currencies concerned.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p144 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">EBA shall develop draft implementing technical standards listing the currencies which meet the requirements set out in paragraph 1.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1">EBA shall submit those draft technical standards to the Commission by 1 January 2014.</P>
<P class="p24 ft1">Power is conferred on the Commission to adopt the implementing technical standards referred to in the third subparagraph in accordance with the procedure laid down in Article 15 of Regulation (EU) No 1093/2010.</P>
<P class="p18 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The own funds requirement on the matched positions in currencies of Member States participating in the second stage of the economic and monetary union may be calculated as 1,6 %of the value of such matched positions.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p18 ft4"><SPAN class="ft1">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft17">Only the unmatched positions in currencies referred to in this Article shall be incorporated into the overall net open position according to Article 341(4).</SPAN></P>
<P class="p256 ft1">36</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_38">


<P class="p137 ft7">Chapter 4</P>
<P class="p257 ft7">Own funds requirements for commodities risk</P>
<P class="p44 ft8">Article 344</P>
<P class="p258 ft8">Choice of method for commodities risk</P>
<P class="p238 ft1">Subject to Articles 345 to 347, institutions shall calculate the own funds requirement for commodities risk with one of the methods set out in Articles 348, 349 or 350.</P>
<P class="p31 ft8">Article 345</P>
<P class="p259 ft8">Ancillary commodities business</P>
<P class="p28 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Institutions with ancillary agricultural commodities business may determine the own funds requirements for their physical commodity stock at the end of each year for the following year where all of the following conditions are met:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p35 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">at any time of the year it holds own funds for this risk which are not lower than the average own funds requirement for that risk estimated on a conservative basis for the coming year;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p34 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">it estimates on a conservative basis the expected volatility for the figure calculated under point (a);</SPAN></P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">its average own funds requirement for this risk does not exceed 5% of its own funds or 1 million EUR and, taking into account the volatility estimated in accordance with (b), the expected peak own funds requirements do not exceed 6.5% of its own funds;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p40 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">The institution monitors on an ongoing basis whether the estimates carried out under points (a) and (b) still reflect the reality.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p29 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Institutions shall notify to the competent authorities the use they make of the option provided in paragraph 1.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p31 ft8">Article 346</P>
<P class="p260 ft8">Positions in commodities</P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Each position in commodities or commodity derivatives shall be expressed in terms of the standard unit of measurement. The spot price in each commodity shall be expressed in the reporting currency.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p217 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Positions in gold or gold derivatives shall be considered as being subject to </SPAN><NOBR>foreign-exchange</NOBR> risk and treated according to Chapter 3 or 5, as appropriate, for the purpose of calculating commodities risk.</P>
<P class="p213 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">For the purposes of this Chapter, positions which are purely stock financing may be excluded.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p261 ft1">37</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_39">


<P class="p193 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">For the purpose of Article 349(1), the excess of an institution's long positions over its short positions, or vice versa, in the same commodity and identical commodity futures, options and warrants shall be its net position in each commodity. Derivative instruments shall be treated, as laid down in Article 347, as positions in the underlying commodity.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p18 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">For the purposes of calculating a position in a commodity, the following positions shall be treated as positions in the same commodity:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">positions in different </SPAN><NOBR>sub-categories</NOBR> of commodities in cases where the <NOBR>sub-categories</NOBR> are deliverable against each other;</P>
<P class="p35 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">positions in similar commodities if they are close substitutes and where a minimum correlation of 0.9 between price movements can be clearly established over a minimum period of one year.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p31 ft8">Article 347</P>
<P class="p262 ft8">Particular instruments</P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Commodity futures and forward commitments to buy or sell individual commodities shall be incorporated in the measurement system as notional amounts in terms of the standard unit of measurement and assigned a maturity with reference to expiry date.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Commodity swaps where one side of the transaction is a fixed price and the other the current market price shall be treated, as a series of positions equal to the notional amount of the contract, with, where relevant, one position corresponding with each payment on the swap and slotted into the maturity bands in Article 348(1). The positions shall be long positions if the institution is paying a fixed price and receiving a floating price and short positions if the institution is receiving a fixed price and paying a floating price. Commodity swaps where the sides of the transaction are in different commodities are to be reported in the relevant reporting ladder for the maturity ladder approach.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p263 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Options and warrants on commodities or on commodity derivatives shall be treated as if they were positions equal in value to the amount of the underlying to which the option refers, multiplied by its delta for the purposes of this Chapter. The latter positions may be netted off against any offsetting positions in the identical underlying commodity or commodity derivative. The delta used shall, where relevant, be that of the exchange concerned, subject to permission by the competent authorities, where that is not available, or for OTC options, that calculated by the institution itself using an appropriate model. Permission shall be granted if the model appropriately estimates the rate of change of the option's or warrant's value with respect to small changes in the market price of the underlying.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p264 ft1">Institutions shall adequately reflect other risks associated with options, apart from the delta risk, in the own funds requirements.</P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">EBA shall develop draft regulatory technical standards defining a range of methods to reflect in the own funds requirements other risks, apart from delta risk, in a manner proportionate to the scale and complexity of institutions' activities in options.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p17 ft1">EBA shall submit those draft regulatory technical standards to the Commission by 1 January 2013.</P>
<P class="p163 ft1">38</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_40">
<DIV id="dimg1">
<INGENBILD zsrc="GZB645240x1.jpg/" id="img1">
</DIV>


<P class="p148 ft1">Power is delegated to the Commission to adopt the regulatory technical standards referred to in the first <NOBR>sub-paragraph</NOBR> in accordance with Articles 10 to 14 of Regulation (EU) No 1093/2010.</P>
<P class="p114 ft4"><SPAN class="ft1">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft17">Where an institution is either of the following, it shall include the commodities concerned in the calculation of its own funds requirement for commodities risk:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">the transferor of commodities or guaranteed rights relating to title to commodities in a repurchase agreement;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">the lender of commodities in a commodities lending agreement.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p265 ft8">Article 348</P>
<P class="p227 ft8">Maturity ladder approach</P>
<P class="p33 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The institution shall use a separate maturity ladder in line with Table 1 for each commodity. All positions in that commodity shall be assigned to the appropriate maturity bands. Physical stocks shall be assigned to the first maturity band between 0 and up to and including 1 month.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p266 ft1">Table 1</P>

<P class="p212 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Positions in the same commodity may be offset and assigned to the appropriate maturity bands on a net basis for the following:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p191 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">positions in contracts maturing on the same date;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p39 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">positions in contracts maturing within 10 days of each other if the contracts are traded on markets which have daily delivery dates.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p268 ft1">39</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_41">


<P class="p193 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The institution shall then calculate the sum of the long positions and the sum of the short positions in each maturity band. The amount of the former which are matched by the latter in a given maturity band shall be the matched positions in that band, while the residual long or short position shall be the unmatched position for the same band.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p18 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">That part of the unmatched long position for a given maturity band that is matched by the unmatched short position, or vice versa, for a maturity band further out shall be the matched position between two maturity bands. That part of the unmatched long or unmatched short position that cannot be thus matched shall be the unmatched position.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p119 ft4"><SPAN class="ft1">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft17">The institution's own funds requirement for each commodity shall be calculated on the basis of the relevant maturity ladder as the sum of the following:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">the sum of the matched long and short positions, multiplied by the appropriate spread rate as indicated in the second column of Table 1 for each maturity band and by the spot price for the commodity;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p35 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">the matched position between two maturity bands for each maturity band into which an unmatched position is carried forward, multiplied by 0,6 %, which is the carry rate and by the spot price for the commodity;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">the residual unmatched positions, multiplied by 15 % which is the outright rate and by the spot price for the commodity.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p18 ft4"><SPAN class="ft1">6.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft17">The institution's overall own funds requirement for commodities risk shall be calculated as the sum of the own funds requirements calculated for each commodity according to paragraph 5.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p220 ft8">Article 349</P>
<P class="p45 ft8">Simplified approach</P>
<P class="p33 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The institution's own funds requirement for each commodity shall be calculated as the sum of the following:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">15 % of the net position, long or short, multiplied by the spot price for the commodity;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">3 % of the gross position, long plus short, multiplied by the spot price for the commodity.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p217 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The institution's overall own funds requirement for commodities risk shall be calculated as the sum of the own funds requirements calculated for each commodity according to paragraph 1.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p95 ft8">Article 350</P>
<P class="p269 ft8">Extended maturity ladder approach</P>
<P class="p219 ft4">Institutions may use the minimum spread, carry and outright rates set out in the following table 2 instead of those indicated in Article 348 provided that the institutions:</P>
<P class="p113 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">undertake significant commodities business;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p270 ft1">40</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_42">
<DIV id="dimg1">
<INGENBILD zsrc="GZB645242x1.jpg/" id="img1">
</DIV>


<P class="p271 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">have an appropriately diversified commodities portfolio;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p70 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">are not yet in a position to use internal models for the purpose of calculating the own funds requirement for commodities risk.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p272 ft1">Institutions shall notify the use they make of this Article to their competent authorities together with evidence of their efforts to implement an internal model for the purpose of calculating the own funds requirement for commodities risk.</P>

<P class="p274 ft7">Chapter 5</P>
<P class="p275 ft7">Use of internal models to calculate own funds requirements</P>
<P class="p276 ft7">Section 1</P>
<P class="p277 ft7">Permission and own funds requirements</P>
<P class="p68 ft8">Article 351</P>
<P class="p242 ft8">Specific and general risks</P>
<P class="p169 ft1">Position risk on a traded debt instrument or equity instrument or derivative thereof may be divided into two components for purposes of this chapter. The first shall be its specific risk component and shall encompass the risk of a price change in the instrument concerned due to factors related to its issuer or, in the case of a derivative, the issuer of the underlying instrument. The general risk component shall encompass the risk of a price change in the instrument due in the case of a traded debt instrument or debt derivative to a change in the level of interest rates or in the case of an equity or equity derivative to a broad <NOBR>equity-market</NOBR> movement unrelated to any specific attributes of individual securities.</P>
<P class="p278 ft8">Article 352</P>
<P class="p146 ft8">Permission to use internal models</P>
<P class="p70 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">After having verified an institution's compliance with the requirements of sections 2, 3 and 4 as relevant, competent authorities shall grant permission to institutions to calculate their own</SPAN></P>
<P class="p279 ft1">41</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_43">


<P class="p231 ft1">funds requirements for one or more of the following risk categories by using their internal models instead of or in combination with the methods in Chapters 2 to 4:</P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">general risk of equity instruments;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">specific risk of equity instruments;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p202 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">general risk of debt instruments;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">specific risk of debt instruments;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p202 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(e)</SPAN><NOBR><SPAN class="ft12">foreign-exchange</SPAN></NOBR> risk;</P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft30">commodities risk.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p280 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">For risk categories for which the institution has not been granted the permission referred to in paragraph 1 to use its internal models, that institution shall continue to calculate own funds requirements in accordance with those Chapters 2, 3 and 4 as relevant. Permission by the competent authorities for the use of internal models shall be required for each risk category. Material changes to the use of internal models, the extension of the use of internal models, in particular to additional risk categories, and the initial calculation of stressed </SPAN><NOBR>value-at-risk</NOBR> according to Article 354(2) require a separate permission by the competent authority.</P>
<P class="p281 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">EBA shall develop draft regulatory technical standards to specify the following:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">the conditions for assessing materiality of extensions and changes to the use of internal models;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p115 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">the assessment methodology under which competent authorities permit institutions to use internal models.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p24 ft1">EBA shall submit those draft regulatory technical standards to the Commission by 1 January 2013.</P>
<P class="p152 ft1">Power is delegated to the Commission to adopt the regulatory technical standards referred to in the first subparagraph in accordance with the procedure laid down in Articles 10 to 14 of Regulation (EU) No 1093/2010.</P>
<P class="p31 ft8">Article 353</P>
<P class="p27 ft8">Own funds requirements when using internal models</P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Each institution using an internal model shall fulfil, in addition to own funds requirements calculated according to Chapters 2, 3 and 4 for those risk categories for which permission to use an internal model has not been granted, an own funds requirement expressed as the sum of points (a) and (b):</SPAN></P>
<P class="p158 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">the higher of the following values:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p282 ft1">42</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_44">


<P class="p186 ft4"><SPAN class="ft1">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft56">its previous day's </SPAN><NOBR>value-at-risk</NOBR> number calculated in accordance with Article 354(1) <NOBR>(VaR<SPAN class="ft57">t-1</SPAN>);</NOBR></P>
<P class="p283 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft15">an average of the daily </SPAN><NOBR>value-at-risk</NOBR> numbers calculated in accordance with Article</P>
<P class="p284 ft4">354(1) on each of the preceding sixty business days (VaR<SPAN class="ft57">avg</SPAN>), multiplied by the multiplication factor (mc) according to Article 355;</P>
<P class="p30 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">the higher of the following values:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p285 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft14">its latest available </SPAN><NOBR>stressed-value-at-risk</NOBR> number calculated in accordance with Article 354(2) <NOBR>(sVaR<SPAN class="ft54">t-1</SPAN>);</NOBR> and</P>
<P class="p235 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft15">an average of the stressed </SPAN><NOBR>value-at-risk</NOBR> numbers calculated in the manner and frequency specified in point 10a during the preceding sixty business days (sVaR<SPAN class="ft54">avg</SPAN>), multiplied by the multiplication factor (ms) according to Article 355;</P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Institutions that use an internal model to calculate their own funds requirement for specific risk of debt instruments shall fulfil an additional own funds requirement expressed as the sum of the following points (a) and (b):</SPAN></P>
<P class="p35 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">the own funds requirement calculated in accordance with Article 326 and 327 for the specific risk of securitisation positions and nth to default credit derivatives in the trading book with the exception of those incorporated in an own funds requirement for the specific risk of the correlation trading portfolio in accordance with Section 4 and, where applicable, the own funds requirement for specific risk in accordance with Chapter 2, Section 6, for those positions in CIUs for which neither the conditions in Article 339(1) nor Article 339(2) are fulfilled;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p286 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">the higher of:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p287 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft14">the most recent risk number for the incremental default and migration risk calculated in accordance with Section 3;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p60 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft15">the average of this number over the preceding 12 weeks.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Institutions that have a correlation trading portfolio, which meets the requirements in Article 327(1) to (3), shall fulfil an additional own funds requirement calculated as the higher of the following:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p34 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">the most recent risk number for the correlation trading portfolio calculated in accordance with Section 5;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">the average of this number over the preceding </SPAN><NOBR>12-weeks;</NOBR></P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">8 % of the own funds requirement that would, at the time of calculation of the most recent risk number referred to in the first indent of this point, be calculated in accordance with Article 327(4) for all those positions incorporated into the internal model for the correlation trading portfolio.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p288 ft1">43</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_45">
<DIV id="dimg1">
<INGENBILD zsrc="GZB645245x1.jpg/" id="img1">
</DIV>


<P class="p10 ft33"><SPAN class="ft32">S</SPAN>ECTION <SPAN class="ft32">2</SPAN></P>
<P class="p289 ft33"><SPAN class="ft32">G</SPAN>ENERAL REQUIREMENTS</P>
<P class="p141 ft8">Article 354</P>
<P class="p290 ft8">VaR and stressed VaR Calculation</P>
<P class="p33 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The calculation of the </SPAN><NOBR>value-at-risk</NOBR> number referred to in Article 353 shall be subject to the following requirements:</P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">daily calculation of the </SPAN><NOBR>value-at-risk</NOBR> number;</P>
<P class="p30 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">a 99</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">th </SPAN>percentile, <NOBR>one-tailed</NOBR> confidence interval;</P>
<P class="p291 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">a </SPAN><NOBR>10-day</NOBR> holding period;</P>
<P class="p159 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">an effective historical observation period of at least one year except where a shorter observation period is justified by a significant upsurge in price volatility;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">at least monthly data set updates.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p24 ft1">The institution may use <NOBR>value-at-risk</NOBR> numbers calculated according to shorter holding periods than 10 days scaled up to 10 days by an appropriate methodology that is reviewed periodically.</P>
<P class="p114 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">In addition, the institution shall at least weekly calculate a stressed </SPAN><NOBR>value-at-risk'</NOBR> of the current portfolio, in accordance with the requirements set out in the first paragraph, with <NOBR>value-at-risk</NOBR> model inputs calibrated to historical data from a continuous <NOBR>12-month</NOBR> period of significant financial stress relevant to the institution's portfolio. The choice of such historical data shall be subject to at least annual review by the institution, which shall notify the outcome to the competent authorities. EBA shall monitor the range of practices for calculating stressed value at risk and shall, in accordance with Article 16 of Regulation (EU) No. 1093/2010, issue guidelines on such practices.</P>
<P class="p141 ft8">Article 355</P>
<P class="p292 ft8">Regulatory backtesting and multiplication factors</P>
<P class="p16 ft4"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft17">The results of the calculations referred to in Article 354 shall be scaled up by the multiplication factors (m</SPAN><SPAN class="ft57">c</SPAN>) and (m<SPAN class="ft57">s</SPAN>).</P>
<P class="p119 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The multiplication factors (m</SPAN><SPAN class="ft54">c</SPAN>) and (m<SPAN class="ft54">s</SPAN>) shall be the sum of 3 and an addend between 0 and 1 in accordance with Table 1. That addend shall depend on the number of overshootings for the most recent 250 business days as evidenced by the institution's <NOBR>back-testing</NOBR> of the <NOBR>value-at-</NOBR> risk number as set out in Article 354(1).</P>
<P class="p293 ft1">Table 1</P>
<P class="p294 ft1">Number of overshootings addend</P>
<P class="p295 ft1">44</P>
</DIV>
