<DIV id="page_98">


<P class="p10 ft6">Title III</P>
<P class="p488 ft6">Reporting on stable funding</P>
<P class="p341 ft8">Article 414</P>
<P class="p489 ft8">Items providing stable funding</P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The following items shall be reported to competent authorities separately in order to allow an assessment of the availability of stable funding:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">own funds;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">the following liabilities not included in point (a):</SPAN></P>
<P class="p59 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft14">retail deposits as defined in Article 409(1);</SPAN></P>
<P class="p60 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft15">of the deposits in (i), those that qualify for the treatment in Article 409(2).</SPAN></P>
<P class="p59 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft16">deposits that qualify for the treatment in Article 410(3);</SPAN></P>
<P class="p287 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(iv)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft55">of the deposits in (iii), those that are subject to a deposit guarantee according to Directive 94/19/EC or equivalent third country deposit guarantees within the terms of Article 409(2);</SPAN></P>
<P class="p490 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(v)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">of the deposits in (iii), those that fall under point (b) in Article 410(3)</SPAN></P>
<P class="p491 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(vi)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft55">amounts deposited not falling under (i) or (iii) if they are not deposited financial customers;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p490 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(vii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft131">all funding obtained from financial customers;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p491 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(viii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft132">separately for amounts falling under (vi) and (vii) respectively, funding from secured lending and capital market driven transactions as defined in Article 188</SPAN></P>
<P class="p492 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">–</SPAN><SPAN class="ft133">collateralised by liquid assets as set out in Article 404;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p492 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">–</SPAN><SPAN class="ft133">collateralised by any other assets;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p287 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(ix)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft55">liabilities resulting from securities issued qualifying for the treatment in Article 124;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p493 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(x)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">other liabilities resulting from securities issued;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p60 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(xi)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft55">any other liabilities.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p33 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Where applicable, all items shall be presented in the following five buckets according to the closer of their maturity date and the earliest date at which they can contractually be called:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">within three months,</SPAN></P>
<P class="p494 ft1">97</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_99">


<P class="p411 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">between three and 6 months;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p202 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">between 6 and 9 months;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">between 9 and 12 months;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">after 12 months.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p161 ft8">Article 415</P>
<P class="p495 ft8">Items requiring stable funding</P>
<P class="p33 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The following items shall be reported to competent authorities separately in order to allow an assessment of the needs for stable funding:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p191 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">the assets referred to in Article 404, broken down by asset type;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p202 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">securities and money market instruments not included in (a);</SPAN></P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">equity securities of </SPAN><NOBR>non-financial</NOBR> entities listed on a major index in a recognised exchange;</P>
<P class="p244 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">other equity securities;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">gold;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p202 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft30">other precious metals;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(g)</SPAN><NOBR><SPAN class="ft11">non-renewable</SPAN></NOBR> loans and receivables, separately those the borrowers of which are:</P>
<P class="p285 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft14">natural persons other than commercial sole proprietor and partnerships and deposits placed by small and medium sized enterprises where the aggregate deposit placed by that client or group of connected clients is less than 1 million EUR;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p496 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft15">sovereigns, central banks and PSEs;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p59 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft16">clients not referred to in (i) and (ii) other than financial customers;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p60 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(iv)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft55">any other borrowers;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(h)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">derivatives receivables;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p202 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft30">any other assets;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p97 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(j)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft30">undrawn credit facilities that qualify as 'medium risk' or 'medium/low risk' under Annex I.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p243 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Where applicable, all items shall be presented in the five buckets described in Article 414(2).</SPAN></P>
<P class="p497 ft1">98</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_100">


<P class="p171 ft6">PART SEVEN</P>
<P class="p498 ft6">LEVERAGE</P>
<P class="p341 ft8">Article 416</P>
<P class="p499 ft8">Calculation of the leverage ratio</P>
<P class="p29 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Institutions shall calculate their leverage ratio according to the methodology set out in paragraphs 2 to 10.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The leverage ratio shall be calculated as an institution's capital measure divided by that institution's total exposure measure and shall be expressed as a percentage.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p24 ft1">Institutions shall calculate the leverage ratio as the simple arithmetic mean of the monthly leverage ratios over a quarter.</P>
<P class="p107 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">For the purposes of paragraph 2, the capital measure shall be the Tier 1 capital.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">The total exposure measure is the sum of the exposure values of all assets and </SPAN><NOBR>off-balance</NOBR> sheet items not deducted when determining the capital measure referred to in paragraph 3.</P>
<P class="p24 ft1">Where institutions include relevant entities in which they hold significant investments in their consolidation according to the relevant accounting framework, but not in their prudential consolidation according to Chapter 2 of Title II of Part One, they shall reduce their exposure measure by the amount that is obtained by multiplying the amount defined in point (a) with the factor defined in point (b):</P>
<P class="p22 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">the sum of the exposure values of all the assets of those relevant entities which are included in the consolidation according to the relevant accounting framework, but not in the prudential consolidation according to Chapter 2 of Title II of Part One;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p35 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">the sum of the deductions from Tier 1 items specified in point (i) of Article 33(1) and in point (d) of Article 53 divided by the total amount of Tier 1 items.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p422 ft1">Institutions shall effect the valuation of assets and <NOBR>off-balance</NOBR> sheet items in accordance with Article 94.</P>
<P class="p18 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Institutions shall determine the exposure value of assets in accordance with the following principles:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p115 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">the exposure values of assets, excluding items listed in Annex II and credit derivatives, means exposure values as defined in Article 106(1);</SPAN></P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">physical or financial collateral, guarantees or credit risk mitigation purchased shall not be used to reduce exposure values of assets;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">netting of loans and deposits shall not be permitted.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p500 ft1">99</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_101">


<P class="p193 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">6.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Institutions shall determine the exposure value of items listed in Annex II and of credit derivatives in accordance with either the </SPAN><NOBR>Mark-to-Market</NOBR> Method set out in Article 269 or the Original Exposure Method set out in Article 270. Institutions may use the Original Exposure Method to determine the exposure value of items listed in Annex II and of credit derivatives only if they also use this method for determining the exposure value of these items for the purposes of meeting the own funds requirements set out in Article 87.</P>
<P class="p19 ft1">In determining the exposure value of items listed in Annex II and of credit derivatives, institutions shall take into account the effects of contracts for novation and other netting agreements, except contractual <NOBR>cross-product</NOBR> netting agreements, in accordance with Article 289.</P>
<P class="p149 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">7.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Institutions shall determine the exposure value of repurchase transactions, securities or commodities lending or borrowing transactions, long settlement transactions and margin lending transactions in accordance with Article 215(1) to (3) and shall take into account the effects of master netting agreements, except contractual </SPAN><NOBR>cross-product</NOBR> netting agreements, in accordance with Article 201.</P>
<P class="p149 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">8.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Institutions shall determine the exposure value of </SPAN><NOBR>off-balance</NOBR> sheet items, except the items listed in Annex II, credit derivatives, repurchase transactions, securities or commodities lending or borrowing transactions, long settlement transactions and margin lending transactions, in accordance with Article 106(1), subject to the following modifications to the specific credit risk adjustments listed in that Article:</P>
<P class="p22 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">the specific credit risk adjustment for undrawn credit facilities, which may be cancelled unconditionally at any time without notice, referred to in the first indent of paragraph 4 of Annex I, is 10%;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p35 ft4"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft13">the specific credit risk adjustment for all other </SPAN><NOBR>off-balance-sheet</NOBR> items listed in Annex I is 100%.</P>
<P class="p119 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">9.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Institutions shall determine the exposure values of items listed in Annex II and of credit derivatives that are </SPAN><NOBR>off-balance</NOBR> sheet items in accordance with the approach set out in paragraph 6.</P>
<P class="p152 ft1">Institutions shall determine the exposure values of repurchase transactions, securities or commodities lending or borrowing transactions, long settlement transactions and margin lending transactions that are <NOBR>off-balance</NOBR> sheet items in accordance with the approach set out in paragraph 7.</P>
<P class="p245 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">10.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft35">For the purpose of the calculations set out in paragraphs 6, 7 and 9 institutions may choose not to apply the principle set out in point (b)of paragraph 5.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p95 ft8">Article 417</P>
<P class="p501 ft8">Reporting requirement</P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Institutions shall submit to the competent authorities all necessary information on the leverage ratio and its components as determined in Article 416. Competent authorities shall take into account this information when undertaking the supervisory review referred to in Article 92 of Directive [inserted by OP].</SPAN></P>
<P class="p502 ft1">100</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_102">


<P class="p231 ft1">Competent authorities shall submit the information received from institutions to EBA upon its request to facilitate the review referred to in Article 482.</P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">EBA shall develop draft implementing technical standards to determine the contents and format of the uniform reporting template for the reporting requirement referred to in paragraph 1, the instructions on how to use such template and the frequencies and dates of reporting.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p17 ft1">EBA shall submit those draft implementing technical standards to the Commission by 1 January 2013.</P>
<P class="p153 ft1">Power is conferred on the Commission to adopt the implementing technical standards referred to in the first subparagraph in accordance with the procedure laid down in Article 15 of Regulation (EU) No 1093/2010.</P>
<P class="p503 ft1">101</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_103">


<P class="p504 ft6">PART EIGHT</P>
<P class="p505 ft6">DISCLOSURE BY INSTITUTIONS</P>
<P class="p446 ft6">Title I</P>
<P class="p506 ft6">General Principles</P>
<P class="p341 ft8">Article 418</P>
<P class="p173 ft8">Scope of disclosure requirements</P>
<P class="p16 ft4"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft17">Institutions shall publicly disclose the information laid down in Title II, subject to the provisions laid down in Article 419.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p486 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Permission by the competent authorities under Part three of the instruments and methodologies referred to in Title III shall be subject to the public disclosure by institutions of the information laid down therein.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p18 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Institutions shall adopt a formal policy to comply with the disclosure requirements laid down in this Part, and have policies for assessing the appropriateness of their disclosures, including their verification and frequency. Institutions shall also have policies for assessing whether their disclosures convey their risk profile comprehensively to market participants.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p17 ft1">Where those disclosures do not convey the risk profile comprehensively to market participants, institutions shall publicly disclose the information necessary in addition to that required in accordance with paragraph 1. However, they shall only be required to disclose information which is material and not proprietary or confidential in accordance with Article 419.</P>
<P class="p149 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Institutions shall, if requested, explain their rating decisions to small and </SPAN><NOBR>medium-size</NOBR> enterprises and other corporate applicants for loans, providing an explanation in writing when asked. The administrative costs of the explanation shall be proportionate to the size of the loan.</P>
<P class="p44 ft8">Article 419</P>
<P class="p507 ft8"><NOBR>Non-material,</NOBR> proprietary or confidential information</P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Institutions may omit one or more of the disclosures listed in Title II if the information provided by such disclosures is not regarded as material, except for the disclosures laid down in Article 424.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p152 ft1">Information shall be regarded as material in disclosures if its omission or misstatement could change or influence the assessment or decision of a user relying on that information for the purpose of making economic decisions.</P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Institutions may also omit one or more items of information included in the disclosures listed in Titles II and III if those items include information which is regarded as proprietary or</SPAN></P>
<P class="p508 ft1">102</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_104">


<P class="p148 ft1">confidential in accordance with the second and third subparagraphs, except for the disclosures laid down in Article 424.</P>
<P class="p23 ft1">Information shall be regarded as proprietary to an institution if disclosing it publicly would undermine its competitive position. It may include information on products or systems which, if shared with competitors, would render an institution's investments therein less valuable.</P>
<P class="p402 ft1">Information shall be regarded as confidential if there are obligations to customers or other counterparty relationships binding an institution to confidentiality.</P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">In the cases referred to in paragraph 2, the institution concerned shall state in its disclosures the fact that the specific items of information are not disclosed, the reason for </SPAN><NOBR>non-disclosure,</NOBR> and publish more general information about the subject matter of the disclosure requirement, except where these are to be classified as proprietary or confidential.</P>
<P class="p95 ft8">Article 420</P>
<P class="p509 ft8">Frequency of disclosure</P>
<P class="p510 ft1">Institutions shall publish the disclosures required by this Part at least on an annual basis.</P>
<P class="p416 ft1">Annual disclosures shall be published in conjunction with the date of publication of the financial statements.</P>
<P class="p511 ft1">Institutions shall assess the need to publish some or all disclosures more frequently than annually in the light of the relevant characteristics of their business such as scale of operations, range of activities, presence in different countries, involvement in different financial sectors, and participation in international financial markets and payment, settlement and clearing systems. That assessment shall pay particular attention to the possible need for more frequent disclosure of items of information laid down in Article 424, and points (b) to (e) of Article 425, and information on risk exposure and other items prone to rapid change.</P>
<P class="p141 ft8">Article 421</P>
<P class="p512 ft8">Means of disclosures</P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Institutions may determine the appropriate medium, location and means of verification to comply effectively with the disclosure requirements laid down in this Part. To the degree feasible, all disclosures shall be provided in one medium or location.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p18 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Equivalent disclosures made by institutions under accounting, listing or other requirements may be deemed to constitute compliance with this Part. If disclosures are not included in the financial statements, institutions shall indicate where they can be found.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p513 ft1">103</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_105">


<P class="p26 ft6">Title II</P>
<P class="p514 ft6">Technical criteria on transparency and disclosure</P>
<P class="p341 ft8">Article 422</P>
<P class="p515 ft8">Risk management objectives and policies</P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Institutions shall disclose their risk management objectives and for each separate category of risk, including the risks referred to under this Title. These disclosures shall include:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">the strategies and processes to manage those risks;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p97 ft4"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft13">the structure and organisation of the relevant risk management function including information on its authority and statute, or other appropriate arrangements;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p30 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">the scope and nature of risk reporting and measurement systems;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p159 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">the policies for hedging and mitigating risk, and the strategies and processes for monitoring the continuing effectiveness of hedges and mitigants;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p40 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">a declaration approved by the management body on the adequacy of risk management arrangements of the institution providing assurance that the risk management systems put in place are adequate with regard to institution's profile and strategy;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft30">a concise risk statement approved by the management body succinctly describing the institution's overall risk profile associated with the business strategy. This statement shall include key ratios and figures providing external stakeholders with a concise but comprehensive view of how risk profile of the institution interacts with the risk tolerance set by the management body.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p119 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Institutions shall disclose the following information, including regular, at least annual updates, regarding governance arrangements:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p191 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">the number of directorships held by members of the management body;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p39 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">the recruitment policy for the selection of members of the management body and their actual knowledge, skills and expertise;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p35 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">the policy on diversity with regard to selection of members of the management body, its objectives and any relevant targets set out in that policy, and the extent to which these objectives and targets have been achieved;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">whether or not the institution has set up a separate risk committee and the number of times the risk committee has met;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p35 ft4"><SPAN class="ft1">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft10">the description of the information flow on risk to the management body in its supervisory function.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p516 ft1">104</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_106">


<P class="p26 ft8">Article 423</P>
<P class="p448 ft8">Scope of application</P>
<P class="p238 ft1">Institutions shall disclose the following information regarding the scope of application of the requirements of this Regulation in accordance with Directive [inserted by OP]:</P>
<P class="p107 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the name of the institution to which the requirements of this Regulation apply;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">an outline of the differences in the basis of consolidation for accounting and prudential purposes, with a brief description of the entities therein, explaining whether they are:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft14">fully consolidated;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft15">proportionally consolidated;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p202 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft16">deducted from own funds;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(iv)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft55">neither consolidated nor deducted;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p33 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">any current or foreseen material practical or legal impediment to the prompt transfer of own funds or repayment of liabilities among the parent undertaking and its subsidiaries;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p218 ft4"><SPAN class="ft1">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft134">the aggregate amount by which the actual own funds are less than required in all subsidiaries not included in the consolidation, and the name or names of such subsidiaries;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p113 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">if applicable, the circumstance of making use of the provisions laid down in Articles 6 and 8</SPAN></P>
<P class="p161 ft8">Article 424</P>
<P class="p517 ft8">Own funds</P>
<P class="p107 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Institutions shall disclose the following information regarding their own funds:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p39 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">a full reconciliation of Common Equity Tier 1 items, Additional Tier 1 items, Tier 2 items and filters and deductions applied pursuant to Articles 29 to 32, 33, 53, 63 and 74 to own funds of the institution and the balance sheet in the audited financial statements of the institution;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p109 ft4"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft13">a description of the main features of the Common Equity Tier 1 and Additional Tier 1 instruments and Tier 2 instruments issued by the institution;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">the full terms and conditions of all Common Equity Tier 1, Additional Tier 1 and Tier 2 instruments;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">separate disclosure of the nature and amounts of the following:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p60 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft14">each prudential filter applied pursuant to Articles 29 to 32;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p59 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft15">each deduction made pursuant to Articles 33, 53 and 63;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p60 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft16">items not deducted in accordance with Articles 44, 45, 53, 63 and 74;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p518 ft1">105</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_107">


<P class="p37 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">a description of all restrictions applied to the calculation of own funds in accordance with this Regulation and the instruments, prudential filters and deductions to which those restrictions apply;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p35 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft30">where institutions disclose capital ratios calculated using elements of own funds determined on a basis other than that laid down in this Regulation, a comprehensive explanation of the basis on which those capital ratios are calculated.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">EBA shall develop draft implementing technical standards to specify uniform templates for disclosure under points (a), (b), (d) and (e) of paragraph 1.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p402 ft4">EBA shall submit those draft implementing technical standards to the Commission by 31 December 2013.</P>
<P class="p19 ft1">Power is conferred on the Commission to adopt the implementing technical standards referred to in the first <NOBR>sub-paragraph</NOBR> in accordance with the procedure laid down in Articles 10 to 14 of Regulation (EU) No 1093/2010.</P>
<P class="p31 ft8">Article 425</P>
<P class="p519 ft8">Own funds requirements</P>
<P class="p520 ft1">Institutions shall disclose the following information regarding the compliance by the institution with the requirements laid down in Articles 87 and Article 72 of Directive [inserted by OP]:</P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">a summary of the institution's approach to assessing the adequacy of its internal capital to support current and future activities;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">for institutions calculating the </SPAN><NOBR>risk-weighted</NOBR> exposure amounts in accordance with Chapter 2 of Part Three, Title II, 8% of the <NOBR>risk-weighted</NOBR> exposure amounts for each of the exposure classes specified in Article 107;</P>
<P class="p18 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">for institutions calculating </SPAN><NOBR>risk-weighted</NOBR> exposure amounts in accordance with Chapter 3 of Part Three, Title II, 8% of the <NOBR>risk-weighted</NOBR> exposure amounts for each of the exposure classes specified in Article 142. For the retail exposure class, this requirement applies to each of the categories of exposures to which the different correlations in Article 149(1) to (4) correspond. For the equity exposure class, this requirement applies to:</P>
<P class="p30 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft14">each of the approaches provided in Article 150;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p97 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft15">exchange traded exposures, private equity exposures in sufficiently diversified portfolios, and other exposures;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft16">exposures subject to supervisory transition regarding own funds requirements;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(iv)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft55">exposures subject to grandfathering provisions regarding own funds requirements;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p432 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">own funds requirements calculated in accordance with points (b) and (c) of Article 87;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">own funds requirements calculated in accordance with Part Three, Title III, Sections 2 to 4 and disclosed separately.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p521 ft1">106</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_108">


<P class="p522 ft1">The institutions calculating the <NOBR>risk-weighted</NOBR> exposure amounts in accordance with Article 148(5) or 150(2) shall disclose the exposures assigned to each category in Table 1 in paragraph 5 of Article 148(5), or to each risk weight mentioned in Article 150(2).</P>
<P class="p31 ft8">Article 426</P>
<P class="p85 ft8">Exposure to counterparty credit risk</P>
<P class="p523 ft1">Institutions shall disclose the following information regarding the institution's exposure to counterparty credit risk as defined in Title III, Chapter 6:</P>
<P class="p29 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">a discussion of the methodology used to assign internal capital and credit limits for counterparty credit exposures;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p107 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">a discussion of policies for securing collateral and establishing credit reserves;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p107 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">a discussion of policies with respect to </SPAN><NOBR>wrong-way</NOBR> risk exposures;</P>
<P class="p33 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">a discussion of the impact of the amount of collateral the institution would have to provide given a downgrade in its credit rating;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p18 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">gross positive fair value of contracts, netting benefits, netted current credit exposure, collateral held and net derivatives credit exposure. Net derivatives credit exposure is the credit exposure on derivatives transactions after considering both the benefits from legally enforceable netting agreements and collateral arrangements;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p18 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft34">measures for exposure value under the methods set out in Sections 3 to 6 of Title III, Chapter 6 whichever method is applicable;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(g)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the notional value of credit derivative hedges, and the distribution of current credit exposure by types of credit exposure;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(h)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the notional amounts of credit derivative transactions, segregated between use for the institution's own credit portfolio, as well as in its intermediation activities, including the distribution of the credit derivatives products used, broken down further by protection bought and sold within each product group;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p119 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft135">the estimate of a if the institution has received the permission of the competent authorities to estimate a.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p31 ft8">Article 427</P>
<P class="p524 ft8">Capital buffers</P>
<P class="p33 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">An institution shall disclose the following information in relation to its compliance with the requirement for a countercyclical capital buffer referred to in Title VII, Chapter 4 of Directive [inserted by OP]:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p34 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">the geographical distribution of its credit exposures relevant for the calculation of its countercyclical capital buffer;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p525 ft1">107</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_109">


<P class="p411 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">the composition of its institution specific countercyclical capital buffer.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p33 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">EBA shall develop draft regulatory technical standards specifying the disclosure requirements set out in paragraph 1.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p526 ft4">EBA shall submit those draft regulatory technical standards to the Commission by 31 December 2014.</P>
<P class="p19 ft1">Power is delegated to the Commission to adopt the regulatory technical standards referred to in the first subparagraph in accordance with the procedure laid down in Articles 10 to 14 of Regulation (EU) No 1093/2010.</P>
<P class="p31 ft8">Article 428</P>
<P class="p504 ft8">Credit risk adjustments</P>
<P class="p219 ft1">Institutions shall disclose the following information regarding the institution's exposure to credit risk and dilution risk:</P>
<P class="p107 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the definitions for accounting purposes of past due and impaired;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p16 ft4"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft134">a description of the approaches and methods adopted for determining specific and general credit risk adjustments;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p119 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the total amount of exposures after accounting offsets and without taking into account the effects of credit risk mitigation, and the average amount of the exposures over the period broken down by different types of exposure classes;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p218 ft4"><SPAN class="ft1">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft134">the geographic distribution of the exposures, broken down in significant areas by material exposure classes, and further detailed if appropriate;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p119 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the distribution of the exposures by industry or counterparty type, broken down by exposure classes, and further detailed if appropriate;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p29 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft34">the residual maturity breakdown of all the exposures, broken down by exposure classes, and further detailed if appropriate;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p107 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(g)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">by significant industry or counterparty type, the amount of:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft14">impaired exposures and past due exposures, provided separately;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft15">Specific and general credit risk adjustments;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p202 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft16">charges for specific and general credit risk adjustments during the reporting period;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(h)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the amount of the impaired exposures and past due exposures, provided separately, broken down by significant geographical areas including, if practical, the amounts of specific and general credit risk adjustments related to each geographical area;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p18 ft4"><SPAN class="ft1">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft136">the reconciliation of changes in the specific and general credit risk adjustments for impaired exposures, shown separately. The information shall comprise:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p527 ft1">108</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_110">


<P class="p411 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft14">a description of the type of specific and general credit risk adjustments;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p202 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft15">the opening balances;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft16">the amounts taken against the credit risk adjustments during the reporting period;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(iv)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft55">the amounts set aside or reversed for estimated probable losses on exposures during the reporting period, any other adjustments including those determined by exchange rate differences, business combinations, acquisitions and disposals of subsidiaries, and transfers between credit risk adjustments;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p191 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(v)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">the closing balances.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p47 ft4">Specific credit risk adjustments and recoveries recorded directly to the income statement shall be disclosed separately.</P>
<P class="p220 ft8">Article 429</P>
<P class="p528 ft8">Use of ECAIs</P>
<P class="p46 ft1">For institutions calculating the <NOBR>risk-weighted</NOBR> exposure amounts in accordance with Part Three, Title II, Chapter 2, the following information shall be disclosed for each of the exposure classes specified in Article 107:</P>
<P class="p213 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the names of the nominated ECAIs and ECAs and the reasons for any changes;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p432 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the exposure classes for which each ECAI or ECA is used;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">a description of the process used to transfer the issuer and issue credit assessments onto items not included in the trading book;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the association of the external rating of each nominated ECAI or ECA with the credit quality steps prescribed in Part Three, Title II, Chapter 2, taking into account that this information needs not be disclosed if the institution complies with the standard association published by EBA;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p149 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the exposure values and the exposure values after credit risk mitigation associated with each credit quality step prescribed in Part Three, Title II, Chapter 2 as well as those deducted from own funds.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p14 ft8">Article 430</P>
<P class="p509 ft8">Exposure to market risk</P>
<P class="p47 ft1">The institutions calculating their own funds requirements in accordance with points (b) and (c) of Article 87(3) shall disclose those requirements separately for each risk referred to in those provisions. In addition, the own funds requirement for specific interest rate risk of securitisation positions shall be disclosed separately.</P>
<P class="p529 ft1">109</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_111">


<P class="p26 ft8">Article 431</P>
<P class="p530 ft8">Operational risk</P>
<P class="p46 ft1">Institutions shall disclose the approaches for the assessment of own funds requirements for operational risk that the institution qualifies for; a description of the methodology set out in Article 301(2), if used by the institution, including a discussion of relevant internal and external factors considered in the institution's measurement approach, and in the case of partial use, the scope and coverage of the different methodologies used.</P>
<P class="p105 ft8">Article 432</P>
<P class="p507 ft8">Exposures in equities not included in the trading book</P>
<P class="p46 ft1">Institutions shall disclose the following information regarding the exposures in equities not included in the trading book:</P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the differentiation between exposures based on their objectives, including for capital gains relationship and strategic reasons, and an overview of the accounting techniques and valuation methodologies used, including key assumptions and practices affecting valuation and any significant changes in these practices;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p119 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the balance sheet value, the fair value and, for those </SPAN><NOBR>exchange-traded,</NOBR> a comparison to the market price where it is materially different from the fair value;</P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the types, nature and amounts of </SPAN><NOBR>exchange-traded</NOBR> exposures, private equity exposures in sufficiently diversified portfolios, and other exposures;</P>
<P class="p107 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the cumulative realised gains or losses arising from sales and liquidations in the period; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the total unrealised gains or losses, the total latent revaluation gains or losses, and any of these amounts included in the original or additional own funds.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p31 ft8">Article 433</P>
<P class="p531 ft8">Exposure to interest rate risk on positions not included in the trading book</P>
<P class="p238 ft1">Institutions shall disclose the following information on their exposure to interest rate risk on positions not included in the trading book:</P>
<P class="p18 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the nature of the interest rate risk and the key assumptions (including assumptions regarding loan prepayments and behaviour of </SPAN><NOBR>non-maturity</NOBR> deposits), and frequency of measurement of the interest rate risk;</P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the variation in earnings, economic value or other relevant measure used by the management for upward and downward rate shocks according to management's method for measuring the interest rate risk, broken down by currency.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p532 ft1">110</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_112">


<P class="p26 ft8">Article 434</P>
<P class="p533 ft8">Exposure to securitisation positions</P>
<P class="p46 ft1">Institutions calculating risk weighted exposure amounts in accordance with Part Three, Title II, Chapter 5 or own funds requirements in accordance with Article 326 or Article 327 shall disclose the following information, where relevant, separately for their trading and <NOBR>non-trading</NOBR> book:</P>
<P class="p38 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">a description of the institutions objectives in relation to securitisation activity;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p432 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the nature of other risks including liquidity risk inherent in securitised assets;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the type of risks in terms of seniority of underlying securitisation positions and in terms of assets underlying those latter securitisation positions assumed and retained with re- securitisation activity;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p213 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the different roles played by the institution in the securitisation process;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p33 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">an indication of the extent of the institutions involvement in each of the roles referred to in point (d);</SPAN></P>
<P class="p114 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft34">a description of the processes in place to monitor changes in the credit and market risk of securitisation exposures including, how the behaviour of the underlying assets impacts securitisation exposures and a description of how those processes differ for </SPAN><NOBR>re-securitisation</NOBR> exposures;</P>
<P class="p114 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(g)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">a description of the institutions policy governing the use of hedging and unfunded protection to mitigate the risks of retained securitisation and </SPAN><NOBR>re-securitisation</NOBR> exposures, including identification of material hedge counterparties by relevant type of risk exposure;</P>
<P class="p18 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(h)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the approaches to calculating risk weighted exposure amounts that the institution follows for its securitisation activities including the types of securitisation exposures to which each approach applies;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p114 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft135">the types of SSPE that the institution, as sponsor, uses to securitise </SPAN><NOBR>third-party</NOBR> exposures including whether and in what form and to what extent the institution has exposures to those SSPEs, separately for on- and <NOBR>off-balance</NOBR> sheet exposures, as well as a list of the entities that the institution manages or advises and that invest in either the securitisation positions that the institution has securitised or in SSPEs that the institution sponsors;</P>
<P class="p113 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(j)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft135">a summary of the institutions accounting policies for securitisation activities, including:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p202 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft14">whether the transactions are treated as sales or financings;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft15">the recognition of gains on sales;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p21 ft4"><SPAN class="ft1">(iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft137">the methods, key assumptions, inputs and changes from the previous period for valuing securitisation positions;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p30 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(iv)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft55">the treatment of synthetic securitisations if not covered by other accounting policies;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p534 ft1">111</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_113">


<P class="p37 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(v)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">how assets awaiting securitisation are valued and whether they are recorded in the institutions </SPAN><NOBR>non-trading</NOBR> book or the trading book;</P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(vi)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft16">policies for recognising liabilities on the balance sheet for arrangements that could require the institution to provide financial support for securitised assets;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(k)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the names of the ECAIs used for securitisations and the types of exposure for which each agency is used;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(l)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft135">where applicable, a description of the Internal Assessment Approach as set out in Part Three, Title II, Chapter 5, Section 3, including the structure of the internal assessment process and relation between internal assessment and external ratings, the use of internal assessment other than for IAA capital purposes, the control mechanisms for the internal assessment process including discussion of independence, accountability, and internal assessment process review, the exposure types to which the internal assessment process is applied and the stress factors used for determining credit enhancement levels, by exposure type;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p197 ft4"><SPAN class="ft1">(m)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft138">an explanation of significant changes to any of the quantitative disclosures in points (n) to (q) since the last reporting period;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p119 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(n)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">separately for the trading and the </SPAN><NOBR>non-trading</NOBR> book, the following information broken down by exposure type:</P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft14">the total amount of outstanding exposures securitised by the institution, separately for traditional and synthetic securitisations and securitisations for which the institution acts only as sponsor;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p34 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft15">the aggregate amount of </SPAN><NOBR>on-balance</NOBR> sheet securitisation positions retained or purchased and <NOBR>off-balance</NOBR> sheet securitisation exposures;</P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft16">the aggregate amount of assets awaiting securitisation;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(iv)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft16">for securitised facilities subject to the early amortisation treatment, the aggregate drawn exposures attributed to the originators and investors interests respectively, the aggregate capital requirements incurred by the institution against the originators interest and the aggregate capital requirements incurred by the institution against the investors shares of drawn balances and undrawn lines;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(v)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">the amount of securitisation positions that are deducted from own funds or </SPAN><NOBR>risk-weighted</NOBR> at 1250 %;</P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(vi)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft55">a summary of the securitisation activity of the current period, including the amount of exposures securitised and recognised gain or loss on sale;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p107 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(o)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">separately for the trading and the </SPAN><NOBR>non-trading</NOBR> book, the following information:</P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft14">the aggregate amount of securitisation positions retained or purchased and the associated capital requirements, broken down between securitisation and </SPAN><NOBR>re-securitisation</NOBR> exposures and further broken down into a meaningful number of <NOBR>risk-weight</NOBR> or capital requirement bands, for each capital requirements approach used;</P>
<P class="p518 ft1">112</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_114">


<P class="p37 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft15">the aggregate amount of </SPAN><NOBR>re-securitisation</NOBR> exposures retained or purchased broken down according to the exposure before and after hedging/insurance and the exposure to financial guarantors, broken down according to guarantor credit worthiness categories or guarantor name;</P>
<P class="p18 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(p)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">for the </SPAN><NOBR>non-trading</NOBR> book and regarding exposures securitised by the institution, the amount of impaired/past due assets securitised and the losses recognised by the institution during the current period, both broken down by exposure type;</P>
<P class="p18 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(q)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">for the trading book, the total outstanding exposures securitised by the institution and subject to a capital requirement for market risk, broken down into traditional/synthetic and by exposure type.";</SPAN></P>
<P class="p114 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(r)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft34">where applicable, whether the institution has provided support within the terms of Article 243(1) and the impact on own funds.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p31 ft8">Article 435</P>
<P class="p512 ft8">Remuneration policy</P>
<P class="p33 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Institutions shall disclose the following information, regarding the remuneration policy and practices of the institution for those categories of staff whose professional activities have a material impact on its risk profile:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p35 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">information concerning the </SPAN><NOBR>decision-making</NOBR> process used for determining the remuneration policy, including if applicable, information about the composition and the mandate of a remuneration committee, the external consultant whose services have been used for the determination of the remuneration policy and the role of the relevant stakeholders;</P>
<P class="p535 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">information on link between pay and performance;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">the most important design characteristics of the remuneration system, including information on the criteria used for performance measurement and risk adjustment, deferral policy and vesting criteria;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p35 ft4"><SPAN class="ft1">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft13">information on the performance criteria on which the entitlement to shares, options or variable components of remuneration is based;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p433 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">the main parameters and rationale for any variable component scheme and any other </SPAN><NOBR>non-cash</NOBR> benefits;</P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft30">aggregate quantitative information on remuneration, broken down by business area;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(g)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">aggregate quantitative information on remuneration, broken down by senior management and members of staff whose actions have a material impact on the risk profile of the institution, indicating the following:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p287 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft14">the amounts of remuneration for the financial year, split into fixed and variable remuneration, and the number of beneficiaries;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p536 ft1">113</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_115">


<P class="p186 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft15">the amounts and forms of variable remuneration, split into cash, shares, share- linked instruments and other types;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p287 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft16">the amounts of outstanding deferred remuneration, split into vested and unvested portions;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p287 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(iv)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft55">the amounts of deferred remuneration awarded during the financial year, paid out and reduced through performance adjustments;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p287 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(v)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">new </SPAN><NOBR>sign-on</NOBR> and severance payments made during the financial year, and the number of beneficiaries of such payments;</P>
<P class="p235 ft4"><SPAN class="ft1">(vi)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft139">the amounts of severance payments awarded during the financial year, number of beneficiaries and highest such award to a single person.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(h)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">the number of individuals being remunerated EUR 1 million or more per financial year, broken down into pay bands of EUR 500 000.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">For institutions that are significant in terms of their size, internal organisation and the nature, scope and the complexity of their activities, the quantitative information referred to in this point shall also be made available to the public at the level of persons who effectively direct the business of the institution within the meaning of Article 13(1) of Directive [inserted by OP].</SPAN></P>
<P class="p451 ft1">Institutions shall comply with the requirements set out in this point in a manner that is appropriate to their size, internal organisation and the nature, scope and complexity of their activities and without prejudice to Directive 95/46/EC.</P>
<P class="p95 ft8">Article 436</P>
<P class="p537 ft8">Leverage</P>
<P class="p33 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Institutions shall disclose the following information regarding their leverage ratio as defined in Article 416 and their management of the risk of excessive leverage as defined in point (B) of Article 4(2) of Directive [inserted by OP]:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p191 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">the leverage ratio;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">a breakdown of the total exposure measure;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p202 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft12">a description of the processes used to manage the risk of excessive leverage;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">a description of the factors that had an impact on the leverage ratio during the period to which the disclosed leverage ratio refers.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">EBA shall develop draft implementing technical standards to determine the uniform disclosure template for the disclosure referred to in paragraph 1 and the instructions on how to use such template.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p402 ft1">EBA shall submit those draft implementing technical standards to the Commission by 30 June 2014.</P>
<P class="p538 ft1">114</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_116">


<P class="p522 ft1">Power is conferred on the Commission to adopt the implementing technical standards referred to in the first subparagraph in accordance with the procedure laid down in Article 15 of Regulation (EU) No 1093/2010.</P>
<P class="p539 ft1">115</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_117">


<P class="p10 ft6">Title III</P>
<P class="p540 ft140">Qualifying requirements for the use of particular instruments or methodologies</P>
<P class="p541 ft8">Article 437</P>
<P class="p542 ft8">Use of the IRB Approach to credit risk</P>
<P class="p543 ft1">Institutions calculating the <NOBR>risk-weighted</NOBR> exposure amounts under the IRB Approach shall disclose the following information</P>
<P class="p107 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the competent authority's permission of the approach or approved transition;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p107 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">an explanation and review of:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft14">the structure of internal rating systems and relation between internal and external ratings;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p115 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft15">the use of internal estimates other than for calculating </SPAN><NOBR>risk-weighted</NOBR> exposure amounts in accordance with Part Three, Title II, Chapter 3;</P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft16">the process for managing and recognising credit risk mitigation;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p97 ft4"><SPAN class="ft1">(iv)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft139">the control mechanisms for rating systems including a description of independence, accountability, and rating systems review;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p119 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">a description of the internal ratings process, provided separately for the following exposure classes:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p244 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft14">central governments and central banks;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft15">institutions;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p202 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft16">corporate, including SMEs, specialised lending and purchased corporate receivables;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(iv)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft55">retail, for each of the categories of exposures to which the different correlations in Article 149(1) to 149(4) correspond;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(v)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft11">equities;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the exposure values for each of the exposure classes specified in Article 142. Exposures to central governments and central banks, institutions and corporates where institutions use own estimates of LGDs or conversion factors for the calculation of </SPAN><NOBR>risk-weighted</NOBR> exposure amounts shall be disclosed separately from exposures for which the institutions do not use such estimates;</P>
<P class="p149 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">for each of the exposure classes central governments and central banks, institutions, corporate and equity, and across a sufficient number of obligor grades (including default) to allow for a meaningful differentiation of credit risk, institutions shall disclose:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p502 ft1">116</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_118">


<P class="p37 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft14">the total exposures, including for the exposure classes central governments and central banks, institutions and corporate, the sum of outstanding loans and exposure values for undrawn commitments; and for equities the outstanding amount;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p191 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft15">the </SPAN><NOBR>exposure-weighted</NOBR> average risk weight;</P>
<P class="p39 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft16">for the institutions using own estimates of conversion factors for the calculation of risk- weighted exposure amounts, the amount of undrawn commitments and exposure- weighted average exposure values for each exposure class;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p18 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft34">For the retail exposure class and for each of the categories as defined under point (c)(iv), either the disclosures outlined under (e) above (if applicable, on a pooled basis), or an analysis of exposures (outstanding loans and exposure values for undrawn commitments) against a sufficient number of EL grades to allow for a meaningful differentiation of credit risk (if applicable, on a pooled basis);</SPAN></P>
<P class="p149 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(g)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the actual specific credit risk adjustments in the preceding period for each exposure class (for retail, for each of the categories as defined under point (c)(iv) and how they differ from past experience;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p114 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(h)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">a description of the factors that impacted on the loss experience in the preceding period (for example, has the institution experienced higher than average default rates, or higher than average LGDs and conversion factors);</SPAN></P>
<P class="p18 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft135">the institution's estimates against actual outcomes over a longer period. At a minimum, this shall include information on estimates of losses against actual losses in each exposure class (for retail, for each of the categories as defined under point (c)(iv) over a period sufficient to allow for a meaningful assessment of the performance of the internal rating processes for each exposure class (for retail for each of the categories as defined under point (c)(iv). Where appropriate, the institutions shall further decompose this to provide analysis of PD and, for the institutions using own estimates of LGDs and/or conversion factors, LGD and conversion factor outcomes against estimates provided in the quantitative risk assessment disclosures above.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p263 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(j)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft135">for all exposure classes specified in Article 142 and for each category of exposure to which the different correlations in Article 149 (1) to 149(4) correspond:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft14">for the institutions using own LGD estimates for the calculation of </SPAN><NOBR>risk-weighted</NOBR> exposure amounts, the <NOBR>exposure-weighted</NOBR> average LGD and PD in percentage for each relevant geographical location of credit exposures;</P>
<P class="p35 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft15">for the institutions that do not use own LGD estimates, the </SPAN><NOBR>exposure-weighted</NOBR> average PD in percentage for each relevant geographical location of credit exposures.</P>
<P class="p47 ft1">For the purposes of point (c), the description shall include the types of exposure included in the exposure class, the definitions, methods and data for estimation and validation of PD and, if applicable, LGD and conversion factors, including assumptions employed in the derivation of these variables, and the descriptions of material deviations from the definition of default as set out in Article 174, including the broad segments affected by such deviations.</P>
<P class="p544 ft1">117</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_119">


<P class="p522 ft1">For the purposes of point (j), the relevant geographical location of credit exposures means exposures in the Member States in which the institution has been authorised and Member States or third countries in which institutions carry out activities through a branch or a subsidiary.</P>
<P class="p31 ft8">Article 438</P>
<P class="p258 ft8">Use of credit risk mitigation techniques</P>
<P class="p510 ft1">The institutions applying credit risk mitigation techniques shall disclose the following information:</P>
<P class="p33 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the policies and processes for, and an indication of the extent to which the entity makes use of, on- and </SPAN><NOBR>off-balance</NOBR> sheet netting;</P>
<P class="p38 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the policies and processes for collateral valuation and management;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p432 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">a description of the main types of collateral taken by the institution;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p107 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the main types of guarantor and credit derivative counterparty and their creditworthiness;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p432 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">information about market or credit risk concentrations within the credit mitigation taken;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft34">for institutions calculating </SPAN><NOBR>risk-weighted</NOBR> exposure amounts under the Standardised Approach or the IRB Approach, but not providing own estimates of LGDs or conversion factors in respect of the exposure class, separately for each exposure class, the total exposure value (after, where applicable, on- or <NOBR>off-balance</NOBR> sheet netting) that is covered  after the application of volatility adjustments  by eligible financial collateral, and other eligible collateral;</P>
<P class="p145 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(g)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">for institutions calculating </SPAN><NOBR>risk-weighted</NOBR> exposure amounts under the Standardised Approach or the IRB Approach, separately for each exposure class, the total exposure (after, where applicable, on- or <NOBR>off-balance</NOBR> sheet netting) that is covered by guarantees or credit derivatives. For the equity exposure class, this requirement applies to each of the approaches provided in Article 150.</P>
<P class="p44 ft8">Article 439</P>
<P class="p545 ft8">Use of the Advanced Measurement Approaches to operational risk</P>
<P class="p47 ft1">The institutions using the Advanced Measurement Approaches set out in Articles 310 to 313 for the calculation of their own funds requirements for operational risk shall disclose a description of the use of insurances and other risk transfer mechanisms for the purpose of mitigation of this risk.</P>
<P class="p95 ft8">Article 440</P>
<P class="p533 ft8">Use of Internal Market Risk Models</P>
<P class="p46 ft1">Institutions calculating their capital requirements in accordance with Article 352 shall disclose the following information:</P>
<P class="p107 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">for each </SPAN><NOBR>sub-portfolio</NOBR> covered:</P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft14">the characteristics of the models used;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p502 ft1">118</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_120">


<P class="p37 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft15">where applicable, for the internal models for incremental default and migration risk and for correlation trading, the methodologies used and the risks measured through the use of an internal model including a description of the approach used by the institution to determine liquidity horizons, the methodologies used to achieve a capital assessment that is consistent with the required soundness standard and the approaches used in the validation of the model;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p535 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft16">a description of stress testing applied to the </SPAN><NOBR>sub-portfolio;</NOBR></P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(iv)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft55">a description of the approaches used for </SPAN><NOBR>back-testing</NOBR> and validating the accuracy and consistency of the internal models and modeling processes;</P>
<P class="p107 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the scope of permission by the competent authority;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">a description of the extent and methodologies for compliance with the requirements set out in Articles 99 and 100;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p107 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the highest, the lowest and the mean of the following:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p94 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft14">the daily </SPAN><NOBR>value-at-risk</NOBR> measures over the reporting period and as per the period end;</P>
<P class="p202 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft15">the stressed </SPAN><NOBR>value-at-risk</NOBR> measures over the reporting period and as per the period end;</P>
<P class="p21 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft16">the risk numbers for incremental default and migration risk and for the specific risk of the correlation trading portfolio over the reporting period and as per the </SPAN><NOBR>period-end;</NOBR></P>
<P class="p107 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the elements of the own funds requirement as specified in Article 353;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p16 ft4"><SPAN class="ft1">(f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft141">the weighted average liquidity horizon for each </SPAN><NOBR>sub-portfolio</NOBR> covered by the internal models for incremental default and migration risk and for correlation trading;</P>
<P class="p119 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(g)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">a comparison of the daily </SPAN><NOBR>end-of-day</NOBR> <NOBR>value-at-risk</NOBR> measures to the <NOBR>one-day</NOBR> changes of the portfolios value by the end of the subsequent business day together with an analysis of any important overshooting during the reporting period.</P>
<P class="p546 ft1">119</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_121">


<P class="p448 ft6">PART NINE</P>
<P class="p547 ft6">DELEGATED AND IMPLEMENTING ACTS</P>
<P class="p341 ft8">Article 441</P>
<P class="p401 ft8">Delegated Acts</P>
<P class="p219 ft1">The Commission shall be empowered to adopt delegated acts in accordance with Article 445, concerning the following aspects:</P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">clarification of the definitions set out in Articles 4, 22, 137, 148, 188, 237, 267, 294, 371 and 400 to ensure uniform application of this Regulation</SPAN></P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">clarification of the definitions set out in Articles 4, 22, 137, 148, 188, 237, 267, 294, 371 and 400 in order to take account, in the application of this Regulation of developments on financial markets;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p114 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">amendment of the list of exposure classes in Articles 107 and 142 in order to take account of developments on financial markets;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the amount specified in point c of Article 118, Article 142(5)(a), Article 148(4) and Article 158(4), to take into account the effects of inflation;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p107 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the list and classification of </SPAN><NOBR>off-balance</NOBR> sheet items in Annexes I and II;</P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft34">adjustment of the categories of investment firms in Article 90(1) and Article 91(1) to take account of developments on financial markets;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(g)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">clarification of the requirement laid down in Article 92 to ensure uniform application of this Regulation.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p107 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(h)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">a clarification of exemptions provided for in Article 389;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft135">the extension by twelve months of the duration of the requirement to provide own funds which are at all times more than or equal to the amount specified in Article 476 beyond the periods provided for in paragraphs 1 and 2 of that Article;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p18 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(j)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft135">the modification of the capital measure and the total exposure measure of the leverage ratio referred to in Article 416(2) in order to correct any shortcomings discovered on the basis of the reporting referred to in Article 417(1) before the leverage ratio has to be published by institutions as set out in Article 436(1)(a). This delegation of power shall be subject to the procedure referred to in Article 446.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p548 ft1">The Commission may adopt a measure as referred to under point (i) of paragraph 1 more than once, provided that the requirement to provide own funds which are at all times more than or equal to the amount specified in Article 476 is extended for consecutive periods of twelve months. However, the requirement may not be extended beyond 31 December 2018. If the requirement is not extended before the expiry of the relevant twelve months period, the Commission may not adopt any further measures under paragraph 1(i).</P>
<P class="p549 ft1">120</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_122">


<P class="p522 ft1">By 30 June 2015, EBA shall report to the Commission whether the evolving economic situation and developments in relevant regulatory requirements would justify an extension of the requirements set out in Article 476.</P>
<P class="p550 ft8">Article 442</P>
<P class="p258 ft8">Technical adjustments and corrections</P>
<P class="p47 ft1">The Commission shall be empowered to adopt delegated acts in accordance with Article 445, to make technical adjustment and corrections of <NOBR>non-essential</NOBR> elements in the following provisions in order to take account of developments on financial markets, in particular new financial products, to make adjustments to developments after the adoption of this Regulation in other EU legislative acts on financial services and accounting including accounting standards based on Regulation No. (EU) 1605/2002, or to reflect convergence of supervisory practice:</P>
<P class="p486 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft59">the own funds requirements for credit risk laid down in Articles 106 to 129, and in Articles 138 to 187;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p38 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the effects of credit risk mitigation in accordance with Articles 189 to 236 ;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p432 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft59">the own funds requirements for securitisation laid down in Articles 238 to 261;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the own funds requirements for counterparty credit risks in accordance with articles 267 to 300;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p243 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft59">the own funds requirements for operational risk laid down in Articles 304 to 313;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p107 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft34">the own funds requirements for market risk laid down in Articles 314 to 367;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p432 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(g)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the own funds requirements for settlement Risk laid down in Articles 368 and 369;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p29 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(h)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the own funds requirements for credit valuation adjustment risk laid down in Articles 373, 374 and 375;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p16 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft135">Part Two and Article 95 as a result of developments in accounting standards or requirements which take account of Union legislation or with regard to the convergence of supervisory practices.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p551 ft8">Article 443</P>
<P class="p552 ft8">Prudential requirements</P>
<P class="p47 ft1">The Commission shall be empowered to adopt delegated acts in accordance with Article 445, to impose stricter prudential requirements, for a limited period of time, for all exposures or for exposures to one or more sectors, regions or Member States, where this is necessary to address changes in the intensity of <NOBR>micro-prudential</NOBR> and <NOBR>macro-prudential</NOBR> risks which arise from market developments emerging after the entry into force of this Regulation, in particular upon the recommendation or opinion of the ESRB, concerning</P>
<P class="p20 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft59">a temporary increase in the level of own funds laid down in Article 87;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p521 ft1">121</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_123">


<P class="p413 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the prudential filters laid down in Articles 29 to 32;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p432 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft59">the deductions from elements of own funds set out in Articles 33, 53 and 63;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p29 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the own funds requirements for credit risk laid down in Articles 106 to 129, and in Articles 138 to 187;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p107 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the effects of credit risk mitigation in accordance with Articles 189 to 236;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p107 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft34">the own funds requirements for securitisation laid down in Articles 238 to 261;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p432 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(g)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the own funds requirements for credit risks in accordance with articles 268 to 300;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p107 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(h)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the own funds requirements for operational risk laid down in Articles 304 to 313;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p107 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft135">the own funds requirements for market risk laid down in Articles 314 to 367;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p432 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(j)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft135">the own funds requirements for settlement Risk laid down in Articles 368 and 369;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p29 ft1"><SPAN class="ft1">(k)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft31">the own funds requirements for credit valuation adjustment risk laid down in Articles 373, 374 and 375.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p510 ft1">This delegation of power shall be subject to the procedure referred to in Article 446.</P>
<P class="p161 ft8">Article 444</P>
